Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drill-pipe cutter||CORRECT||||||drillpipe cutter||CORRECT||DEF: A tool to cut drill pipe that is stuck in the hole.||"OBS: Cutting the pipe, allows some of it to be withdrawn. There are models for cutting from the outside (external) and from the inside (internal)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drill-pipe pressure gauge||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An indicator that is mounted in the mud-circulating system and measures and indicates the amount of pressure in the drill stem.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drill-pipe pressure||CORRECT||||||drillpipe pressure||CORRECT||"DEF: The amount of pressure exerted inside the drill pipe, which is the result of circulating pressure, the entry of formation pressure into the well, or both."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drill-pipe protector||CORRECT||||||drillpipe protector||CORRECT||DEF: An antifriction device of rubber or steel attached to each joint of drill to minimize wear.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drill-pipe safety valve||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A special valve used to close off the drill pipe to prevent flow and having threads to match the drill pipe in use.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drillable liner||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||driller's console||CORRECT||||||driller's panel||CORRECT||DEF: A metal cabinet on the rig floor containing the controls that the driller manipulates to operate various functions of the drilling rig.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drilling head||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A special rotating head with a gear and pinion drive arrangement to turn the kelly while at the same time sealing the kelly against well pressure.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drilling mast||CORRECT||||||mast||CORRECT||"DEF: A portable derrick capable of being erected as a unit, as distinguished from a standard derrick, which cannot be raised to a working position as a unit."||"OBS: [A mast consists] of two parallel legs, in contrast to the conventional four-legged derrick in the form of a pyramid. The mast is held upright by guy wires."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drilling platform||CORRECT||||||derrick platform;platform||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: An immobile, offshore structure constructed on pilings from which wells are either drilled, produced, or both."||"CONT: The drilling platform, built on a large-diameter pipe frame, supports the drilling of a number of wells from the location."||CONT: The ability to accurately measure and predict the dynamic response properties of a fixed offshore drilling platform is an important concern to the industry.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drilling recorder||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: An instrument that makes a record of hook load, penetration rate, rotary speed and torque, pump rate and pressure, mud flow, etc., as drilling is going on."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drilling spool||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An accessory used as a spacer in the wellhead equipment.||OBS: It provides room between various pieces of wellhead devices (as the blowout preventers) so that devices in the drill stem (as a tool joint) can be suspended in it.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drillpipe float valve||CORRECT||||||drill-pipe float||CORRECT||DEF: A valve installed in the drill stem that allows mud to be pumped down the drill stem but prevents flow back up the drill stem ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drive clamp||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A collar fitted on a churn drill string to enable it to be used as a hammer to drive casing pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drive pipe||||||||driving pipe
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||drive-in unit||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A type of portable servicing or workover rig that is self-propelled, utilizing power from the hoisting engines."||OBS: The driver's cab and steering wheel are mounted on the same end as the mast support; thus the unit can be driven straight ahead to reach the wellhead.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dry mud||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Barite or other minerals which may be mixed with water to form drilling mud.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dry string||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The drill pipe from which drilling mud has been emptied as it is pulled out of the wellbore.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dual packer||CORRECT||||||||||OBS: dual: consisting of two ...||"OBS: packer: A device lowered into a borehole, which automatically swells or can be made to expand at the correct time by manipulation from the surface to produce a watertight joint against the sides of the borehole or the casing."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dump bailer||"CORRECT||GENERIC"||||||dump-bottom bailer||"CORRECT||GENERIC"||"DEF: A bailing device with a release valve, usually of the disk or flapper type, that is used to place or spot material (as cement slurry) at the bottom of a well."||CONT: This technique ... called laying in a plug ... may be accomplished by placing the cement with a dump-bottom bailer on a wire line or by pumping cement down the drill pipe or tubing.||"OBS: dump bailer; dump-bottom bailer: These terms are more general than  cement dump bailer|| since they are used for cement or any other slurry material."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||duplex pump||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A reciprocating pump having two pistons or plungers.||OBS: Duplex pumps are extensively used as mud pumps on drilling rigs.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dutchman||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A tool-joint pin broken off in the drill-pipe box or drill-collar box.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||dynamometer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to measure the brake horsepower of a prime mover.||"OBS: As applied to sucker-rod pumping, the dynamometer indicates the variation in load on the polished rod as the rod string reciprocates. A continuous record of the result of forces acting along the axis of the polished rod is provided on a dynamometer card, from which an analysis is made of the performance of the well-pumping equipment."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||earth anchor||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||electric rig||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drilling rig on which the energy from the power source is distributed to the various rig components through electrical conductors as opposed to distribution by mechanical transmission.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||electrodrill||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drilling machine driven by electric power.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||elevator bail||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The linkage between the elevator and traveling block.||OBS: Term generally plural.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||elevator link||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to hang the tubing elevators to the tubing hook.||OBS: Term generally plural.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||elevators||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: A set of clamps that grip a stand, or column, of casing, tubing, drill pipe, or sucker rods, so that the stand can be raised or lowered into the hole."||"CONT: When elevators are attached to a hook on the traveling block and when drill pipe or tubing is latched in the elevators, the pipe can be raised or lowered in the derrick or mast."||OBS: elevators: term rarely used in the singular (elevator).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||emergency shutdown valve||CORRECT||ESDV||CORRECT||||||"DEF: A valve that automatically closes to isolate a hydrocarbon storage well from surface piping in the event of specified conditions that, if uncontrolled, may cause an emergency."||CONT: The operator shall ... subject every well-head fail-close emergency shutdown valve of the well site or field facility to an operating and pressure-holding test at least once every six months and shall immediately replace defective valves.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||endless tubing||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Small diameter coiled steel tubing which can be run into a conventional well for well servicing operations.||"OBS: Nitrogen, acid or other chemicals may be fed into the captive end of the spool and pumped to the well bottom below a packer for purging or acidizing operations, as appropriate."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||epicyclic speed reduction gearbox||||||||||||"CONT: ... probably the most successful drill without a rotating stem is the Bristol-Siddeley turbo-drill, designed by Sir Frank Whittle. This incorporates a compact multi-stage turbine motivated by the drilling mud, an epicyclic speed reduction gearbox, and a device for automatically adjusting the pressure on the bit ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||expansion spool||CORRECT||||||||||CONT: Before drilling operations are begun it is necessary to construct a concrete cellar ... to support the weight of the drilling rig and later to accommodate the wellhead valving and expansion spool.||"OBS: spool: Any of several cylindrical devices which have a rim, ridge, or head at each end and commonly an axial hole for a pin or spindle and on whcih filamentary or ribbonlike material ... is wound."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||expendable gun||CORRECT||||||expendable perforator||CORRECT||"DEF: A perforating gun that consists of a metal strip upon which are mounted shaped charges in special capsules. After firing, essentially nothing but debris remains of the gun."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||expendable-retrievable gun||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A perforating gun that consists of a hollow, cylindrical carrier into which are placed shaped charges; upon detonation, any debris created by the exploded charges falls into the carrier and is retrieved along with it when the gun is pulled; however, the gun cannot be reused."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||extension rod||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: With a powerful hydraulic rock drill and carousel storage for extension rods, the operator uses remote controls to perform rock drilling from a safe position."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||external clamp||CORRECT||||||||||"OBS: clamp: A device to grip and hold in position a piece or part, or hold or bind together two or more parts, usually with jaws or cheeks, at least one of which is movable."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||external cutter||CORRECT||||||outside cutter;outside pipe cutter;external pipe cutter||"CORRECT||||"||"DEF: A fishing tool that contains metal-cutting knives and is lowered over the outside of a length of pipe in the hole in order to cut the pipe. After the pipe is cut, the severed portion can then be brought to the surface."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fast line||CORRECT||||||fastline||CORRECT||DEF: The end of the drilling line that is affixed to the drum or reel of the drawworks; so called because it travels with greater velocity than any other portion of the drilling line.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||finger grip||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A fishing tool designed to recover a broken drill rod or dropped tool from a borehole.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fingerboard||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A rack that supports stands of pipe being stacked in a derrick or mast.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||firing hole plug||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A brightly-coloured plastic cone of variable diameter used to identify shot holes loaded with explosives ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fishing tool||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A tool designed for the specific purpose of recovering equipment from the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fishtail bit||CORRECT||||||fish-tail bit;fish tail bit;fish tail;drag bit||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A rotary bit used to drill soft formations. The blade is flattened and divided, the divided ends curving away from the direction of rotation. It resembles a fishtail."||"DEF: A bit usually employed in the rotary system of drilling. It is used for drilling in soft strata, such as sand and clay."||OBS: Fish-tail bit is generally used for drilling through overburden or soft formations free of boulders.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flange up||"CORRECT||VERB PHRASE"||||||||||DEF: To use flanges to make final connections on a piping system.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flanged pipe||CORRECT||||||||||CONT: Every operator shall ensure that the minimum blow out prevention system ... includes a securely stacked choice line with minimum nominal 75 mm diameter flanged pipe ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flex joint||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device that provides a flexible connection between the riser pipe and the subsea blowout preventers.||"OBS: By accommodating lateral movement of a mobile offshore drilling rig, flex joints help to prevent a buildup of abnormal bending load pressure."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flexible drilling||||||||flexo-drilling technique
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flexible joint||"CORRECT||STANDARDIZED"||||||||||DEF: Joint capable of allowing relative movement between the component parts. [Definition standardized by ISO.]||"OBS: Examples of this type of joint are: a) socket and spigot joints with an elastomeric sealing element (including double socket designs); b) flexible locked socket and spigot joints with an elastomeric sealing element (including double socket designs); c) clamped joints, for example bolted couplings including joints made from materials other than GRP."||"CONT: Inside diameter of the riser pipe and its size compatibility with the subsea blowout preventers and the proposed well program are important to the potential customer. The telescoping joint, its diameter and length of stroke, and the type of flexible joint, its diameter and maximum angle, need consideration."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||float collar||CORRECT||FC||||casing float collar||CORRECT||"DEF: A special coupling device, inserted one or two joints above the bottom of the casing string, that contains a check valve to permit fluid to pass downward but not upward through the casing."||"CONT: The float collar prevents drilling mud from entering the casing while it is being lowered, allowing the casing to float during its descent and also decreasing the load on the derrick. The float collar also prevents a backflow of cement during the cementing operation."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||float shoe||CORRECT||||||casing float shoe||CORRECT||"DEF: A short, heavy, cylindrical steel section with a rounded bottom, attached to the bottom of the casing string."||OBS: [The float shoe] contains a check valve and functions similarly to the float collar but also serves as a guide shoe for the casing.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||floater||CORRECT||||||floating vessel||||DEF: An offshore drilling structure that does not come into contact (except possibly by means of anchors) with the ocean floor.||"CONT: Semisubmersible drilling rigs and drill ships are floaters. Platforms, submersible drilling rigs, and jack-up drilling rigs are not floaters once they are readied for drilling. However, submersibles and jack-up rigs are floaters in the sense that they float prior to being positioned over the drilling site ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flow nipple||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A short piece of pipe which is the same size outside the flow line connections but is bored to a much smaller size to restrict the flow; used to control a flowing well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flow treater||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A single unit that acts as an oil and gas separator, an oil heater, and an oil- and water- treating vessel."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fluid-loss additive||CORRECT||||||fluid-loss control agent||CORRECT||DEF: A compound placed in cement slurry or drilling mud that is used to prevent or minimize fluid loss.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flush turbine||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||flush-joint casing||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A casing in which the outside diameter of the joint is the same as the outside diameter of the casing itself.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||follow-up bit||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||forble board||CORRECT||||||fourble board||CORRECT||DEF: A board or platform located in the upper part of the derrick at a suitable elevation so that a man can easily manipulate equipment used to raise or lower drill rods or pipe when same are being handled in stands of four joints each.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fore and aft||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: Lengthwise of a mobile, offshore drilling rig or ship."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||forward||"CORRECT||ADV"||||||||||"DEF: On offshore drilling rigs, in the direction of the bow."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||four-cutter bit||CORRECT||||||quadricone||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||four-way drag bit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drag bit with four blades.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fourable||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||fourble;forble;quad||"CORRECT||NOUN;CORRECT||NOUN;CORRECT||NOUN"||"DEF: A section of drill pipe, casing, or tubing consisting of four joints screwed together."||"OBS: See also  single||  double|| and  thribble. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||fracturing tank||CORRECT||||||frac tank||CORRECT||CONT: The frac fluid is mixed and stored in frac tanks.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||free-point indicator||CORRECT||||||free point indicator||CORRECT||DEF: ... A tool that is designed to measure the amount of stretch in a string of stuck pipe and to indicate the deepest point at which the pipe is free.||"CONT: The free-point indicator is lowered into the well on a conducting cable. Each end of a strain-gauge element is anchored to the pipe wall by friction springs or magnets, and, as strain is put on the pipe, a very accurate measurement of its stretch is transmitted to the surface. By interpreting the stretch measurements, the depth at which the pipe is stuck is determined."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||freeboard deck||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The uppermost continuous deck having a permanent means of closing all openings to the sea on a ship or mobile, offshore drilling rig."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||full-gauge bit||CORRECT||||||full-gage bit||CORRECT||DEF: A bit that has maintained its original diameter.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||full-load displacement||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The displacement of a mobile, offshore drilling rig or ship when floating at its deepest design draft."||OBS: full-load displacement: Terminology officially approved by the Naval Terminology Standardization Committee.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gage loss||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The diametrical reduction in the size of a bit or reaming shell caused by wear through use.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||garbet rod||CORRECT||||||garbot rod;garbutt rod||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A short rod on the lower end of the traveling valve of a rod pump. It is attached to the standing valve and used to pull the valve out of its seat when repairs are necessary.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gas anchor||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A tubular, perforated device that is attached to the bottom of a sucker-rod pump and serves to prevent failure of the pump (gas lock) because of gas entry into the pump."||"OBS: The device works on the principle that gas is lighter than oil and rises. As well fluids enter the anchor, the gas breaks out of the fluid and exits the anchor through perforations near the top. The remaining fluids enter the pump through a mosquito bill (a tube within the anchor), which has an opening near the bottom of the anchor. In this way, all or most of the gas is given the opportunity to escape before the fluids enter the pump."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gas platform||CORRECT||||||gas rig platform;gas drilling platform;gas-drilling platform||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"CONT: Oil and gas platforms. Since 1981 Gleitbau Salzburg has left its mark on reinforced concrete platform construction projects around the world. ... The extreme conditions [in the North Sea projects in the 70s] forced them to create innovations which today are the foundation for geo-metrically complicated and immensely high building structures. ... The services include ... the heavy lifting technique assists in the raising of pre-cast concrete elements or fabricated steel platforms into both the drilling and utility shafts, onto monolithically cast support brackets."||CONT: After a significant gas leak on a gas platform it was found that drawings did not reflect the actual plant.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gas-detecting device||CORRECT||||||gas detector||CORRECT||CONT: A portion of the mud is diverted through a gas-detecting device and examined further under ultraviolet light for the purpose of detecting the presence of oil or gas.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gas-lift mandrel||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device installed in the tubing string of a gas-lift well onto which or into which a gas-lift valve is installed.||OBS: The two most common types of mandrels are the conventional mandrel and the sidepocket mandrel.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gas-lift valve||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A device installed on a gas-lift mandrel, which in turn is put on the tubing string of a gas-lift well. Tubing and casing pressures cause the valve to open and close thus allowing gas to be injected into the fluid in the tubing to cause the fluid to rise to the surface."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||geolograph||CORRECT||||||Geolograph||"CORRECT||TRADEMARK"||DEF: ... a patented device that automatically records the rate of penetration and depth during drilling operations ...||"OBS: ... a Geolograph is a rate-of-penetration recorder. Interestingly, this term is applied to almost any brand of rate-of-penetration recorder, much as Jell-O is used to refer to any brand of flavored-gelatin dessert."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||girt||CORRECT||||||girth||CORRECT||DEF: One of the horizontal braces between the legs of a derrick.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gooseneck||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The curved connection between the rotary hose and swivel.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||group production meter||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A meter that measures the total production from more than one well.||"CONT: Where the operator of a pool uses a group production meter or test production meter to measure fluids produced from the pool, the operator shall calibrate the meter and maintain the calibration ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guard||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||DEF: A metal shield placed around moving parts of machinery to prevent injury to personnel.||"OBS: In the oil field, these are used on such equipment as belts, power-transmission chains, drums, flywheel, and drive shafts."||"OBS: See also  belt guard. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guide base||CORRECT||||||||||"PHR: Permanent, temporary guide base."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guide lines||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||guidelines||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||DEF: Lines (usually four) attached to the temporary guide base and permanent guide base that serve as a means to accurately position equipment (as the blowout preventers) on the ocean floor when an offshore well is being drilled.||OBS: guide lines; guidelines: terms rarely used in the singular (guide line; guideline).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guide shoe||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A short, heavy, cylindrical steel section, filled with concrete and rounded at the bottom, which is placed at the bottom end of the casing string."||CONT: The guide shoe prevents the casing from hanging up on irregularities in the borehole as it is lowered. A passage through the center of the shoe allows the drilling fluid to pass up into the casing while it is being lowered and the cement to pass out through the shoe during cementing operations.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||gun barrel||CORRECT||||||gunbarrel;gunbarrel tank||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A settling tank used in separating oil and water in the field ...||"CONT: After emulsified oil is heated and treated with chemicals, it is pumped into the gun barrel, where the water settles out and is drawn off, and the clean oil flows out to storage."||"OBS: Gun barrels have largely been replaced by unified heater-treater equipment; however, they are still quite common, especially in older fields."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guy-line anchor||CORRECT||||||guy anchor||||DEF: A buried weight or anchor to hold a guy line.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||guy||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||guy rope;stay;guy line;guyline;guycable||"CORRECT;CORRECT||NOUN;CORRECT;CORRECT||"||DEF: A wire line attached to a mast or derrick to provide stability.||"DEF: A supporting rope, cable, or wire which is anchored at one end and tied to a mast, shear legs, derrick, or other in order to stabilize it."||OBS: The lines that provide the main support for the structure are called load guys; the wire lines attached to ground anchors to give lateral support to the structure are termed wind guys.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hammer drill||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A drilling tool that when placed in the drill stem just above a roller-cone bit, imparts high-frequency percussion blows to the rotating bit."||"OBS: Thus, hammer drilling combines the basic features of both rotary and cable-tool drilling (i.e., bit rotation and percussion)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hang rods||"CORRECT||VERB PHRASE"||||||||||DEF: To suspend sucker rods in a derrick or mast on rod hangers rather than place them horizontally on a rack.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hay section||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A section of a heater or a heater-treater that is filled with fibrous material through which oil and water emulsion may be filtered.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hayrack||CORRECT||||||hayrake||CORRECT||DEF: A device mounted on the derrick into which pipe is placed in an orderly fashion while making a trip.||OBS: The rack resembles the farm tool after which it is named; now obsolete in that a fingerboard is most often used.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||headache post||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: On cable-tool rigs, the post that supports the end of the walking beam while the rig is not in operation."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||headboard||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The crossbeam at the top of the drawworks.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||heave compensator||CORRECT||||||surface-motion compensator;drill string compensator;drilling rig DSC||"CORRECT||||"||"DEF: A device that moves with the vertical motion of a floating, offshore drilling rig in order to prevent the bit from being lifted off the bottom of the hole and then dropped back down (i.e., the device maintains constant weight on the bit in spite of vessel heave)."||OBS: heave compensator
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||heave||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||heaving||"CORRECT||SEE OBS"||"DEF: The motion of a ship or floating, offshore drilling rig as it moves vertically up and down."||"OBS: heaving: Vertical motion of a ship, as distinguished from pitching."||"OBS: According to BAKOC 66 and ENSCI 77,  heave or  heaving designate both the vertical rise and fall of a ship and its rectilinear movement, whereas AUTEC 69 makes a distinction between the rectilinear movement ( mouvement principal ) and the vertical rise and fall ( pilonnement ), which is seen as a  mouvement secondaire ."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||heavyweight drill pipe||CORRECT||||||heavyweight drillpipe||CORRECT||"DEF: Drill pipe having thicker walls and longer tool joints than ordinary drill pipe, in addition to integral wear pad in the middle."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hinged bellows||CORRECT||||||hinged expansion bellows||||CONT: [Hinged bellows] are capable of angular flexure without net axial yield. They transmit only minimal axial thrusts when used in three-pin arch loops ...||"OBS: bellows: Flexible element of an expansion joint, consisting of one or more convolutions, [usually] formed from thin metal."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hoisting cable||CORRECT||||||hoist cable||||"DEF: The cable that supports the drill pipe, swivel, hook, and traveling block on a rotary drilling rig."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hoisting drum||CORRECT||||||hoist drum;drawworks drum;drum||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: The large, flanged spool in the drawworks on which the hoisting cable is wound"||CONT: The drawworks drum is that part of the hoist upon which the drilling line is wound.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hoisting plug||CORRECT||||||lifting sub;lifting nipple||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A plug with extended shoulder surfaces screwed into the ends of drill collars to supply a safe method of lifting with elevators ...||CONT: Lifting subs are used with drill collars to provide a shoulder to fit the drill collar to the drill-pipe elevators.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hold-down||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||DEF: A mechanical arrangement to prevent the upward movement of certain pieces of equipment installed in a well.||OBS: A sucker-rod pump may use a mechanical hold-down for attachment to a seating nipple.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||holiday||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A gap or void in the coating of a pipeline ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hollow carrier gun||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A perforating gun consisting of a hollow, cylindrical, metal tube into which are loaded shaped charges or bullets. On detonation, any debris caused by the exploded charges falls into the carrier to be retrieved along with the gun. This type of gun is reusable."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hook load||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: The maximum hook load, 3000 kN, can be achieved if only one of the four main-mast sections which is 21 m long is used and the lift is made at a distance of 6||5 m from the main mast."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hook-wall packer||CORRECT||||||wall-hook packer||CORRECT||DEF: A packer equipped with friction blocks or drag springs and slips and that is so designed that rotation of the pipe unlatches the slips.||OBS: The friction springs prevent the slips and hook from turning with the pipe and assist in advancing the slips up a tapered sleeve to engage the wall of the outside pipe as weight is put on the packer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hooks||"CORRECT||PLUR"||||||||||DEF: Pipe-laying tongs named for the shape of the pipe-gripping head of the scissor-like wrench.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hook||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"DEF: A piece of hard material, especially metal, formed into a curve for catching, holding, or pulling something."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||horse head||CORRECT||||||horsehead;mule-head hanger;mule head||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The curved section on the oil-well end of the walking beam of a beam pumping unit from which the bridle is suspended.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hot spot||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An abnormally hot place on a casing coupling while a joint is making up.||OBS: It usually indicates galled threads and always requires investigation and inspection of the threads on the pipe and in the coupling.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hydraulic control pod||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used on offshore drilling rigs to provide a way of actuating and controlling the subsea blowout preventers from the rig.||"CONT: Hydraulic lines from the rig enter the pods, and the fluid is directed to the preventers. Normally, two pods are used, should one fail, the other can be employed. Often one of the pods is painted blue and the other yellow to make it easy to identify which pod is in use."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hydraulic pump||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to lift oil from wells without the use of sucker rods.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hydro-test||"CORRECT||VERB"||||||||||DEF: To apply hydraulic pressure (usually with water) in order to find leaks in tubing or tubing couplings.||"OBS: This operation is usually carried out as the tubing is being run into the well. Should water leak from any place in the tubing, either the joint of tubing or the coupling (or perhaps both) are replaced."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||hydromatic brake||CORRECT||||||hydromatic||"CORRECT||NOUN"||DEF: A device mounted on the end of the drawworks shaft of a drilling rig that serves as an auxiliary to the mechanical brake when pipe is lowered into the well.||CONT: The braking effect in a hydromatic brake is achieved by means of a runner or impeller turning in a housing filled with water.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ice deflecting hull||||||||||||CONT: The Kulluck drilling platform has a special ice deflecting hull that can withstand the crushing pressure of pack ice during late spring.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||idiot stick||"CORRECT||JARGON"||||||idiot spoon||"CORRECT||JARGON"||"DEF: Any shovel, rake, hoe, or other similar or stick hand tool."||OBS: idiot stick; idiot spoon: slang terms.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ignition device||CORRECT||||||ignition element||CORRECT||"CONT: Oil well cartridges are tubular devices consisting of a thin fiber, metal or composition shell, each containing ... propellant powder and having no ignition device or element."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ignorant end||"CORRECT||JARGON"||||||||||DEF: The heaviest end of a piece of equipment.||OBS: (as a length of pipe or a wrench).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||impression block||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A block with lead on another relatively soft material on the bottom of it, which is made up on drill pipe or tubing at the surface, run into a well and allowed to rest on a tool or other object that has been lost in the well."||"OBS: On retrieval to the surface, an idea of the size, shape and position of the fish is obtained from an examination of the impression left in the lead, and the appropriate fishing tools may be selected."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||initial stability||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The resistance offered by a ship to inclination from the upright position. It is measured by the metacentric height.||DEF: The stability of an offshore drilling rig in an upright condition or with a very small angle of heel.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||inserted-joint casing||CORRECT||||||casing with inserted joints||||"DEF: Casing, the box-thread ends of which are belled or swaged outward to receive the pin-thread portion of another piece of casing when coupled together; ..."||"OBS: Also, sometimes incorrectly used as a synonym for flush-coupled casing."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||inside blowout preventer||CORRECT||||||internal preventer||CORRECT||"DEF: A valve installed in the drill stem to avoid a blowout inside the stem. Flow is possible only in a down direction, allowing mud to be pumped down the stem but preventing any flow back up the stem."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||inside caliper||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A caliper that has two legs with feet that turn outward; used to measure inside dimensions, as the diameter of a hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||inside diameter||CORRECT||"ID||id||i.d."||"CORRECT||CORRECT||CORRECT"||internal diameter;inner diameter;minor diameter||"CORRECT||||"||"DEF: The length of line which passes through the center of a hollow cylindrical or spherical object, and whose end points lie on the inner surface of the object."||"CONT: In the measurement of pipe diameters, the inside diameter -ID - is that of the interior circle ..."||"CONT: Because lengths of pipe are joined by external-diameter couplings threaded by standard tools, an increase in the wall thickness can only be obtained by decreasing the internal diameter."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||insulating flange||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A flange that incorporates plastic pieces to separate the metal parts, thus preventing the inflow of electric current."||CONT: Frequently insulating flanges are employed in cathodic protection systems to prevent electrolytic corrosion. They are often installed when a flowline is attached to a wellhead.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||intermediate casing string||CORRECT||||||intermediate string;intermediate conductor;intermediate casing||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: The string of casing set in a well after the surface casing. Its purpose is to keep the hole from caving and, sometimes, to afford a strong string of pipe to which blowout preventers can be attached."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||intermittor||CORRECT||||||intermitter||CORRECT||DEF: A regulation device used in production of a flowing well.||OBS: The well flows wide open (or through a choke) for short periods several times a day and is then closed in.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||internal clamp||CORRECT||||||||||OBS: Internal: situated or existing within something ...||"OBS: Clamp: a device to grip and hold in position a piece or part, or hold or bind together two or more parts, usually with jaws or cheeks, at least one of which is movable."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||internal cutter||CORRECT||||||inside cutter;inside pipe cutter||"CORRECT||"||"DEF: A fishing tool, containing metal-cutting knives, that is lowered into the inside of a length of pipe stuck in the hole to cut the pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||internal upset||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An extra-thick inside wall provided on the end of tubing or drill pipe at the point where the pipe is threaded in order to compensate for the metal removed in threading.||"OBS: Conventional drill pipe has the extra thickness on the outside. Drill pipe with internal upset has the extra thickness on the inside with a uniform, straight wall on the outside."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||internal-upset pipe||CORRECT||||||internal-upset drillpipe||CORRECT||DEF: The tubular goods in which the pipe walls at the end where threads are to be cut are thickened (upset) on the inside to provide extra strength in the tool joints. Therefore the outside wall of the pipe is the same diameter throughout its length. Upset casing is normally run at the top of long strings in deep operations.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jack and circle||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The apparatus consisting of a powerful jack and a steel-toothed circle on which the jack moves. The circle is attached to the drill floor, centered on the borehole collar, and used to tighten or loosen the joints in a string of drill tools."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jack board||CORRECT||||||stabbing jack||"CORRECT||LESS FREQ"||DEF: A device used to support the end of a length of pipe while another length is being screwed onto the pipe ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jack post||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Either of the posts supporting the crankshaft of a deep-well-boring apparatus.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jack-boot off||"CORRECT||VERB PHRASE"||||||||||DEF: To shear off; said of cable tools that part at the eye of the drill stem as a result of drilling with a slack line. The cable tools always break above the rope socket.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jacket||CORRECT||||||steel jacket;platform jacket||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A support that is firmly secured to the ocean floor and to which the legs of a platform are anchored.||OBS: [This platform section extends] from the base to the deck [and] encloses all the conductor pipes ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jackknife mast||CORRECT||||||jackknife;jack-knife mast;jack-knife drilling mast;jack-knife derrick||"CORRECT||NOUN||||||"||"DEF: A structural-steel, open-sided tower that is raised to the vertical position by means of special lifting tackle attached to the traveling block."||"DEF: jack-knife derrick: Commonly used term to a cantilever mast that can be laid down in one piece for moving, as opposed to a standard derrick which has to be dismantled and re-erected, piece by piece."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jackknife rig||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drilling rig that features a jackknife mast instead of a standard derrick.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jar accelerator||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A hydraulic tool used in conjunction with a jar and made up on the fishing string above it to increase the power of the hammer blow.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jar tester||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jar||CORRECT||||||drilling jar||CORRECT||DEF: A percussion tool that operates on a mechanical or hydraulic principle and is designed to deliver a heavy hammer blow to objects in the borehole to which it is attached.||CONT: Jars are used for such purposes as freeing stuck objects in the hole in fishing operations or imparting a jarring motion to stuck tubing or drill pipe for the purpose of freeing it.||"OBS: The design of the jar often permits blows to be delivered in either a downward or upward direction, with control being effected at the surface."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jerk line||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A short rope used on the cathead of the drilling rig to tighten pipe joints by pulling on the makeup tongs.||"OBS: When the driller activates the cathead, the cathead pulls on the jerk line with great force to apply torque to break out a tool joint (or to tighten a drill collar connection)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jet bit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drilling bit having nozzles through which the drilling fluid is directed in a high-velocity stream to the bottom of the hole to improve the efficiency of the bit.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jet gun||CORRECT||||||jet-perforating gun;jet perforating gun;jet perforator;shaped-charge perforator;shaped charge perforator;shaped charge gun||"CORRECT||||||||||"||"DEF: The assembly, including the carrier and shaped charges, used in jet perforating."||CONT: Perforations are usually made with bullet- or jet-perforating guns.||"OBS: jet perforating: Perforating holes in an oil string in preparation for production from a well. In jet perforating the holes are punched by shaped charges, rather than a projectile, as in gun perforating."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jet hopper||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||jockey stick||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A wooden rod ... extending from the headache post to the wire-line drilling clamps; used to prevent the clamps from turning during the drilling of a pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||joint||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"DEF: A single length of drill pipe, drill collar, casing, tubing, or rod that has threaded connections at both ends."||OBS: A joint of drill pipe is usually 30 ft long. Several joints screwed together constitute a stand of pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||junk basket||CORRECT||||||junk catcher||||DEF: A device made up on the bottom of the drill stem to cut a core into the bottom of the hole on which junk rests.||"OBS: As the core is cut, the junk enters a barrel in the tool and is retained therein by metal projections (catchers). The junk comes out of the hole along with the core when the basket is brought back to the surface."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||junk mill||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Mills are run on drill pipe or tubing and are used for such purposes as grinding up debris in the hole, removing stuck portions of drill stem, removing sections of casing for sidetracking, and reaming out tight spots in casing. They are variously termed junk mills, reaming mills, etc., according to the use for which they were designed."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||junk pusher||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||junk rack||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||junk sub||CORRECT||||||junk retriever;basket sub;boot sub;boot basket||"CORRECT||||||"||"DEF: A tool run just above the bit or mill in the drill stem that serves to catch small, non drillable objects circulating in the space between the wall of the hole and the drill stem."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||kelly bushing||"CORRECT||SEE OBS"||KB||CORRECT||drive bushing;square bit drive||CORRECT;SEE OBS||DEF: A device fitted to the rotary table through which the kelly passes and by means of which the torque of the rotary table is transmitted to the kelly and to the drill stem.||CONT: The drive bushing may be square or hexagonal in shape to fit the rotary opening or have pins for transmitting torque.||OBS: KB: the abbreviation for kelly bushing; used in drilling reports.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||kelly saver sub||"CORRECT||SPECIFIC"||||||kelly-saver sub||CORRECT||DEF: A saver sub that fits in the drill stem between the kelly and drill pipe.||"OBS: Since a large number of joints of drill pipe are made up on the kelly, the saver minimizes wear on the threads of the kelly in that the drill pipe actually mates with the threads of the saver rather than the kelly."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||kelly spinner||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A pneumatically-operated device mounted on top of the kelly that, when actuated, causes the kelly to turn or spin."||"OBS: It is useful when the kelly or a joint or pipe attached to it must be spun up, i.e., rotated rapidly in order to make up the kelly or pipe in another joint of pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||kelly wiper||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||kelly||CORRECT||||||kelly bar;kelly joint;kelly stem;grief joint;grief stem;griefstem||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||OBSOLETE;CORRECT"||"DEF: The heavy, square or hexagonal, steel member that is suspended from the swivel through the rotary table and is connected to the topmost joint of drill pipe to turn the drill stem as the rotary table turns."||CONT: The kelly is free to move down through the rotary table as the bit and drill pipe advance in the hole.||"OBS: grief stem: An old-fashioned term for a heavy, square pipe that works through the square hole in the rotary table ... This is generally called the  kelly or a  kelly joint. Sometimes it has a hexagonal cross section."

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||knock-off block||CORRECT||||||knock off block;knock off post||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The post and hook that are used to hang off a well operated through a rod line.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||leak-repair clamp||CORRECT||||||leak clamp;saddle clamp||"CORRECT||LESS FREQ||"||"CONT: A leak-repair clamp holds a piece of metal with the same curvature as the pipe over a hole in a pipeline, pressing the metal and a gasket firmly against the pipe and effecting a temporary seal of the leak."||OBS: Sometimes this is referred to as a saddle clamp.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||length of drillpipe||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||lie key||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A tool on which boring rods are hung when being raised or lowered in a borehole.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||light displacement||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: On mobile, offshore drilling rigs, the weight of the rig with all permanently attached equipment but without fuel, supplies, crew, ballast, drill pipe, etc."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||limber hole||CORRECT||||||drain hole||||"DEF: A hole cut in a structural member of a ship or offshore drilling rig, usually in a tank, to allow water to pass through freely."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||liner hanger||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A slip device that attaches the liner to the casing.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||liner||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Any string of casing whose top is located below the surface.||"CONT: A liner may serve as the oil string, extending from the producing interval to the next string of casing. A blank liner has no perforations. A perforated liner is perforated or slotted before being placed in the hole. A screen liner is perforated and then arranged with a wire wrapping which acts as a sieve to prevent the entry of sand particles."||OBS: The liner is used to isolate or case off a section of hole below casing that has already been installed. It extends only a short distance into the bottom of the casing string above and does not extend all the way to the surface.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||load binder||CORRECT||||||boomer||"CORRECT||JARGON"||"DEF: A chain or cable with a latching device used to secure loads on trucks, especially pipes ..."||DEF: ... a device used to tighten chains on a load of pipe or other equipment on a truck to make it secure.||OBS: boomer: slang.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||load guy line||CORRECT||||||load guy||CORRECT||CONT: The lines that provide the main support for the structure are called load guys.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||long thread||"CORRECT||STANDARDIZED"||||||||||DEF: One of two types of threads that are cut on casing as standardized by API.||OBS: The other [type] is the short thread.||OBS: long thread: term standardized by ISO.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||lost pipe||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The drill pipe, drill collars, tubing, or casing that has somehow managed to become separated, either unintentionally or intentionally, from that part of the pipe reaching the surface, therefore necessitating its removal before normal operations can proceed; in short, a fish."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||lubricator||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A specially fabricated length of casing or tubing that is usually temporarily placed above a valve on top of the casing or tubing head.||"CONT: Lubricators are used to run tools or substances into a producing well without having to kill the well (make it stop producing). For this reason, lubricators afford a method of sealing off pressure yet still allow the passage of a device, usually on a wire line, or substance into the well."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||macaroni string||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A string of tubing of very small diameter.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||macaroni tubing||CORRECT||||||macaroni pipe||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||macaroni||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A small drill pipe which can enter pipe as small as 2 inches in diameter.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||main deck||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The principal deck extending from front to back of a ship or offshore drilling rig.||"CONT: [Offshore] drilling ... proceeds as on land, the wellhead being set on a cellar deck approximately 15 ft below the main deck."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||main sill||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The sill which extends from a point under the derrick floor, where it rests upon the nose sill, back to a point beyond the location of the sand reel. It lies at a slight angle to the center line of the rig, rests upon four mud sills, supports the Sampson post, and acts as the mainstay which ties the rig front together."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||make up a joint||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: To screw a length of pipe into another length of pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||makeup cathead||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The cathead used as a power source for screwing together joints of pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||marine riser connector||CORRECT||||||riser connector||CORRECT||DEF: A fitting on top of the subsea blowout preventers to which the riser pipe is connected.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||master bushing||CORRECT||||||rotary bushing||CORRECT||"DEF: An adapter used to reduce the size of the opening through the rotary table and to fit the slips, etc. It may be split in two pieces or may be a solid ring."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||master valve||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A large valve located on the Christmas tree and used to control the flow of oil and gas from the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||master valve||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The blind or blank rams of a blowout preventer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||maximum allowable pressure||"CORRECT||STANDARDIZED"||||||maximum permissible pressure||||"DEF: For GRP pipes or fittings, the calculated maximum internal water pressure in bars which the pipe or fitting, as manufactured, will withstand, without failure, for 50 years at 23°C. This pressure is determined by extrapolation of results of long-term pressure tests, taking into account a factor of safety for those nominal service conditions."||OBS: maximum allowable pressure: term and definition standardized by ISO.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||measurement while drilling tool||CORRECT||||||measurement-while-drilling tool;MWD tool;MWD bit;measurement while drilling bit||"CORRECT;CORRECT||||"||CONT: ... MWD tools measure different parameters.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||measuring device||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A special reel and power arrangement for single-stranded wire line to make depth measurements in a well. A calibrated wheel and roller assembly is used to measure the footage of wire line as it is lowered into the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||measuring tank||CORRECT||||||metering tank;dump tank||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A calibrated tank that, by means of weirs, float switches, pressure switches, in similar devices, automatically measures the volume of liquid run in and then released."||OBS: Measuring tanks are used in LACT [lease automatic custody transfer] systems and may also be referred to as metering tanks or dump tanks.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mechanical jar||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A percussion tool operated mechanically to give an upward thrust to a fish by the sudden release of a tripping device inside the tool.||"OBS: If the fish can be freed by an upward blow, the mechanical jar can be very effective."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mechanical packer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A mechanically activated plug used to insulate a zone of a well either temporarily or permanently ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mechanical rig||CORRECT||||||power rig||CORRECT||"DEF: A drilling rig in which the source of power is one or more internal-combustion engines ... and in which the power is distributed to rig components through mechanical devices (as chains, sprockets, clutches, and shafts)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||meter run point||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The point in a gas-gathering system at which a field measuring meter and accessories are situated.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||milling tool||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A tool used in some fishing jobs to reduce the size of the end of a fish to enable the driller to make fast to it.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||monkeyboard||CORRECT||||||monkey board;safety platform;racking board;tubing board||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The derrickman's working platform.||"CONT: As pipe or tubing is run into or out of the hole, the derrickman must handle the top end of the pipe, which may be as high as 90 ft in the derrick or mast. The monkeyboard provides a small platform to raise him to the proper height to be able to handle the top of the pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||moonpool||CORRECT||||||moon pool;center drill well||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A walled, round hole or well in the hull of a drill ship (usually in the center) through which the drilling and other assemblies pass while a well is being drilled, completed, or abandoned from the drill ship."||"CONT: Unlike traditional vessels, [drill vessels] are modified by a center opening through the vessel for conducting drilling operations. This center opening is commonly called a  moonpool. "||"CONT: Most of the development of equipment and technology for rotary drilling from floating vessels started with an extensive shallow-hole coring operation off the coast of California in the Santa Barbara Channel. The very first operations were conducted  over the side of the drill vessel, but these were quickly supplanted by vessels designed with a center drill well or  moonpool. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||moored floating drilling platform||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mooring line||"CORRECT||SEE OBS"||||||anchor line;anchoring line;securing line||"CORRECT||||"||"DEF: Cable connecting anchor with drill barge, float or other vessel, or drilling tower."||"CONT: Mooring lines consisting of wire rope, chain, or a combination of the two have been successfully used in floating drilling. Recently, synthetic fiber rope has been considered for mooring lines in combination with chain at the anchor end ..."||OBS: mooring line: terminology to be used by the Department of National Defence.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mosquito bill||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A tube mounted at the bottom of a sucker-rod pump and inside a gas anchor to provide a conduit for well fluids (with little or no gas) into the pump.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mother hubbard||"CORRECT||JARGON"||||||mud saver;splash box;wet box;mud box||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"||"DEF: A hinged, metal, cylindrical device that is placed around a joint of pipe as it is being broken out during a trip out of the hole. It serves to keep mud from splashing beyond the immediate area."||OBS: mother hubbard: a slang term.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mother submarine||||||||mother sub||||"OBS: mother: Used attributively to designate aircraft or ships that carry, launch, or direct other aircraft or ships."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||motion compensator||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: Any device (as a bumper sub or heave compensator) that serves to maintain constant weight on the bit in spite of vertical motion of a floating, offshore drilling rig."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mousehole connection||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The addition of a length of drill pipe or tubing to the active string. The length to be added is placed in the mousehole, made up to the kelly, pulled out of the mousehole, and subsequently made up into the string."||"OBS: Compare with  rathole connection. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mousehole||CORRECT||||||mouse hole;hurry-up hole||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: ... an opening on the rig floor that extends downward through the substructure and a short distance into the ground, in which a length of drill pipe is temporarily placed for later connection to the drill stem."||CONT: The mousehole is used to stow the next joint of pipe until it is required for threading into the drill string.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mousetrap||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A cylindrical fishing tool fitted with an inward-opening flap valve at the bottom end, used to recover small metal fragments from the bottom of a borehole."||DEF: A fishing tool used to recover a parted string of sucker rods from a well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mud balance||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A beam balance consisting of a cup and a graduated arm carrying a sliding weight and resting on a fulcrum, used for determining the density or weight of drilling mud."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mud gun||CORRECT||||||agitator;surface gun;submarine gun||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A pipe that shoots a jet of drilling mud under high pressure into the mud pit in order to mix additives with the mud.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mud motor||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A downhole drilling motor that is powered by the force of the drilling mud pushed through the motor by the mud pumps at the surface.   
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mud-return line||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A trough or pipe placed between the surface connections at the wellbore and the shale shaker, through which drilling fluid (mud) flows upon its return to the surface from down the hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mud-weight recorder||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An instrument installed in the mud pits that has a recorder mounted on the rig floor to give a continuous reading of the mud weight.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||mudsill||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The lowest timber or sill of a ... derrick ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||multishot instrument||CORRECT||||||multiple-shot instrument||CORRECT||DEF: A borehole-survey instrument capable of taking and recording a series of inclination and bearing readings on a single trip into a borehole.||CONT: A multishot survey instrument is used to obtain numerous readings in the hole as the device is pulled out of the well.||CONT: Multishot gyroscopic instrument.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||nigger||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A detachable length of heavy pipe made and sold as part of a large wrench; used to give added length and leverage to the wrench, thus allowing more pressure on the grip of the wrench."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||nonmagnetic drill collar||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drill collar manufactured of an alloy that does not affect the readings of a magnetic compass placed therein to obtain subsurface indications of the direction of a deviated wellbore.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||nose sill||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A short piece of timber placed beneath the end of the main sill of a standard rig front.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||off-shore jacket||CORRECT||||||||||OBS: jacket: A support that is firmly secured to the ocean floor and to which the legs of a platform are anchored.||"OBS: The design of a jacket, i.e. a lifted, launched or self-floating jacket, is determined primarily by the offshore installation equipment available and the intended water depth. In general the preference is to lift the jacket in place. The size of such jackets has [been] increasing as offshore lifting capacity has grown. With modern lifting capacity now up to 14||000 tonnes, jackets approaching this order of magnitude are now candidates for lifting into position."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||offsites||"SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||OBS: offsites: term rarely used in the singular (offsite).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil and gas separator||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An item of production equipment used to separate the liquid components of the well stream from the gaseous elements.||"OBS: Separators may be vertical or horizontal, cylindrical vessels, or they may be spherical in shape. Separation of the oil and gas is accomplished principally by gravity, the heavier liquids falling to the bottom and the gas rising to the top. The gas leaves from the top of the separator, and the oil leaves from the bottom. A float valve or other liquid-level control regulates the level of oil in the bottom of the separator."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil platform||CORRECT||||||oil rig platform;oil drilling platform||CORRECT;CORRECT||"CONT: Oil platforms are offshore drilling rigs that stand on the seabed. The tallest is the Auger platform in the Gulf of Mexico. It stands in 872 metres of water. The Gullfaks C platform in the North Sea stands on concrete pillars and supports production equipment, loading derricks, and a helicopter pad."||"CONT: Oil rig platform. [There are] many different types and designs of structures ... They range from small steel lattice-work structures, through to large, heavy concrete or steel structures, pinned or weighted down and, more recently, floating production and under water extraction systems."||"CONT: ... an oil drilling platform in frigid northern waters populated with icebergs ... is designed to fend off and, if necessary, absorb the impact of approaching icebergs."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil rig||CORRECT||||||oil drilling rig;oil-drilling rig||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A rig that drills for oil and gas.||"CONT: An oil rig is a contraption which makes a hole in the ground to allow one to retrieve profitable quantities of oil or gas. It may be as simple as a hammer and a basket lowered on a cable (a  cable tool , still used ... in some parts of West Virginia), but since 1900 a  rig refers to a rotary drilling rig, wherein a bit is screwed onto the bottom of some pipe, and the pipe is turned at the surface ( rotary ) and the whole  drill string drills a hole into the ground."||"OBS: rig: 1. An assembly of hole boring equipment used for drilling for oil or gas. The principal components of a rig ... comprise a derrick, the drawworks, with its drilling line, crown and travelling blocks, and a drilling fluid circulation system, including standpipe, flexible hose, mud tanks and pumps. ... 2. A self-contained unit equipped with hole boring equipment and used for drilling for oil or gas offshore."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil saver||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A gland arrangement that seals by pressure and is used to prevent leakage and waste of gas, oil, or water around a wireline (as when swabbing a well). It is operated either mechanically or hydraulically."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil string||CORRECT||||||inner conductor;production casing;oil string casing||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The final string of casing set in a well after the productive capacity of the formation has been assured.||"CONT: The oil string ... contains the flow string of production tubing which conveys the fluid from the producing formation to the surface. Generally it is made from 7 (177.8 mm) OD casing, but sometimes a liner pipe is used at the bottom of a well to extend the string to the producing zone."||"CONT: When oil is found, the drilling stops. The bit and string are pulled out of the hole, and a pipe called a production casing is put into the hole and cemented in place. Another pipe, called tubing, is put inside the casing. The oil will be pumped through the tubing, which is connected to valves on a Christmas tree."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil well cartridge||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Oil well cartridges are tubular devices consisting of a thin fiber, metal or composition shell, each containing not more than 22.7 grams (350 grains) of propellant powder and having no ignition device or element."
