Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil-country tubular goods||"CORRECT||PLUR"||||||oil country tubular goods||"CORRECT||PLUR"||"DEF: Well casing, tubing, drill pipe, drill collars, and line pipe."||"OBS: See also  tubular goods. "||OBS: goods: term not used in the singular (good).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oil-pipe inspector||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||on-shore equipment||||||||onshore equipment
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||on-stream||"CORRECT||ADJ"||||||onstream||"CORRECT||ADJ"||DEF: Descriptive of a pump or pump station that is operating to move oil by pumping ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||oriented drill pipe||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A drill pipe run in a well in a definite position; often a requisite in directional drilling.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||out-of-gauge bit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A bit that is no longer of the proper diameter.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||outer conductor||CORRECT||||||foundation pile;anchor string||"CORRECT;CORRECT||LESS FREQ"||DEF: The first casing or conductor string (generally 30 or 36 in. in diameter) that is set in the drilling of a well from an offshore drilling rig. It prevents sloughing of the ocean-floor formations and is a structural support for the permanent guide base and blowout preventers.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||outside diameter||CORRECT||OD||CORRECT||external diameter||CORRECT||"DEF: The outer diameter of a pipe, including the wall thickness; usually measured with calipers."||CONT: In the measurement of pipe diameters ... the outside diameter - OD - is the diameter of the circle formed by the exterior surface of the pipe.||"CONT: Casing, tubing, and drill pipe are designated by external diameter. ... the external diameter is the same for all weights of the same size pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||overshot||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||socket||CORRECT||DEF: A fishing tool attached to tubing or drill pipe that is lowered over the outside wall of pipe or sucker rod lost or stuck in the wellbore.||"CONT: A friction device on the overshot, usually either a basket or a spiral grapple, firmly grips the pipe allowing the lost fish to be pulled from the hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||packed-hole assembly||CORRECT||||||packed hole assembly||||DEF: A drill stem that consists of a number of stabilizers and special drill collars and is used to maintain the hole the proper angle and course.||CONT: A packed-hole assembly is often necessary in crooked-hole country.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pantograph||||||||||||"DEF: A linkwork consisting of four light rigid bars adjustably jointed in parallelogram ... used as a reducing motion for an indicator, a parallel motion for a beam engine or in a similar function ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||paraffin scraper||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Any tool that is used to remove paraffin from inside tubular goods.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||parted rods||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: Sucker rods that have been broken and separated in a pumping well because of corrosion, improper loading, damaged rods, etc."||OBS: parted rods: term rarely used in the singular (parted rod).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||percussion drilling tool||CORRECT||||||percussion drill bit;percussion bit;churn drill||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A piece of drilling equipment in which the drill is raised by a rope or cable and allowed to drop, pulverizing the rock with successive blows."||CONT: The earliest type of drilling bit was the percussion bit for cable-tool drilling. The percussion bit is alternately lifted and dropped while suspended at the end of the drilling cable.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||perforated completion||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A well completion in which the production casing or liner is punctured to allow passage between the wellbore and the producing formation.||OBS: Perforations are usually made with bullet- or jet-perforating guns.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||perforated liner||CORRECT||||||slotted liner;perforated casing;slotted casing||"CORRECT||||"||DEF: A relatively short length of pipe with holes or slots that is placed opposite producing formation.||"CONT: It is of the outmost importance that all casings, except the perforated liners, be firmly cemented into position."||"OBS: Usually, it is wrapped with specially shaped wire that is designed to prevent the entry of loose sand into the well as it is produced. It is also often used with gravel pack."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||perforated pipe||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The sections of pipe (as casing liners, tail pipes, etc.) in which holes or slots have been cut before setting."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||perforating gun||CORRECT||||||gun perforator||CORRECT||DEF: A device fitted with shaped charges or bullets that is lowered to the desired depth in a well and fired to create penetrating holes in casing (or liner) and cement and some distance into the formation.||"DEF: A special tool used downhole for shooting holes in the well's casing opposite the producing formation. The gun, a steel tube of various lengths, has steel projectiles placed at intervals over its outer circumference, perpendicular to the gun's long axis. When lowered into the well's casing on a wire line opposite the formation to be produced, the gun is fired electrically, shooting numerous holes in the casing which permit oil or gas to flow into the casing."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||permanent guide base||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A structure attached to and installed with the foundation pile when a well is drilled from an offshore drilling rig. It is seated in the temporary guide base and serves as a wellhead housing. Also, guidelines are attached to it so that equipment (as the blowout preventers) may be guided into place on the wellhead."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||photoclinometer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device for simultaneously measuring the amount and direction of deviation of a borehole. 
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pickle||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||DEF: A cylindrical or spherical device that is affixed to the end of a wire line just above the hook for the purpose of keeping the line straight and providing weight.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pilot mill||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A special mill that has a heavy, tubular extension below it called a pilot or stinger. The pilot, smaller in diameter than the mill, is designed to go inside drill pipe or tubing that is lost in the hole. It guides the mill to the top of and centers it over the pipe, thus preventing the mill from bypassing the pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pin packer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A packer in which the packing element is held in position by brass or steel pins.||"OBS: When weight is put on the packer, two metal sleeves telescope, shearing the pins and allowing the element to fold and pack off."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pin tap||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A short, threaded device made up on the bottom of drill pipe or tubing and used to screw into the box of a stand of drill pipe or drill collars lost in the hole. Once the pin tap is engaged, the lost pipe is retrieved."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe fittings||"CORRECT||PLUR"||||||fittings||"CORRECT||PLUR"||"DEF: The auxiliary parts (as couplings, elbows, tees, crosses, etc.) used for connecting lengths of pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe layer||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe rack||CORRECT||||||rack;storage rack||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A frame built by the side of a drilling well to store drill pipe or casing horizontally.||"CONT: In addition to the rig, the platform will also support living quarters ..., cranes and storage racks for drill pipes, drill collars, casing and probably production equipment."||"CONT: The main upper deck [of a jack-up platform] is the pipe rack and storage area, and the mud pumps, tanks, generators and other machinery are located within the hull."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe ram||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A sealing component of a blowout preventer that closes the annular space between the pipe and the blowout preventer or wellhead.||"CONT: Pipe rams, sometimes called  gates , are shaped to fit around drill pipe, so they provide not only an effective seal but act as a support for the pipe should a joint need to be uncoupled."||"CONT: ... pipe rams, when closed, have a configuration such that they seal around the pipe; ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe spool||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A section of piping, which is prefabricated in a piping shop for future installation in the field."||"CONT: Induction bent pipe spools ( weldless pipe spools) is common practice today in: power stations (traditional and nuclear - primary and auxiliary circuits); gas and oil pipelines (onshore and offshore)."||"OBS: [Pipe spools] are often flanged, to facilitate the connection to other spools."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe support||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Pipe supports between anchors may take the form of simple sliding pads on concrete blocks, of flexible upright metal rods capable of bending one way or suspension rods hanging from light portal or  gallows frames."||OBS: The breakage of pipes caused by movements of the building can be avoided by placing the pipe in supports that will permit some motion between the pipe and the support.||"PHR: Metal, plastic, steel pipe support."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pipe wiper||CORRECT||||||pipe-wiper||||DEF: A device built similar to a rod wiper but designed to be used on a drill pipe.||"DEF: A disk-shaped device, with a hole in the center through which drill pipe or tubing passes, that is used to wipe off mud, oil, or other liquid from the pipe as the pipe is pulled from the hole."||DEF: A device with half-round rubber blades held in place by hydraulic rams that is bolted to the floor of a rig and cleans drilling mud from drill pipes as they emerge from the hole.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pit-level indicator||CORRECT||||||pit-level recorder;pit-volume indicator;Pit Volume Totalizer||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||TRADEMARK"||DEF: ... a series of devices that continuously monitor the level of the drilling mud in the mud pits.||"CONT: PVT's usually consist of float devices in the mud pits that sense mud-level data and transmit this data to a recording and alarm device mounted near the driller's position on the rig floor. Should the mud level in the pits drop too low or get too high ..., the alarm sounds to warn the driller that action may be necessary to prevent a blowout."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||plug container||CORRECT||||||||||OBS: [The] cementing head ... has passages for cement slurry and retainer chambers for one or more cementing wiper plugs.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pneumatic control||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A control valve that is actuated by air.||"CONT: Several pneumatic controls are used on drilling rigs to actuate rig components (as clutches, hoists, engines, pumps, etc."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||polished rod||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The topmost portion of a string of sucker rods, which is used for lifting fluid by the rod-pumping method."||CONT: The polished rod has a uniform diameter and is smoothly polished to effectively seal pressure in the stuffing box attached to the top of a well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||polished-rod clamp||CORRECT||||||||||CONT: A polished-rod clamp is used to attach the top of the polished rod to the bridle of a pumping unit.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pontoon||CORRECT||||||footing;caisson||"CORRECT;CORRECT||SEE OBS"||"DEF: The base of a caisson or stabilizing column of a semi-submersible drilling rig, which may be filled with ballast for buoyancy adjustment, or with stores, such as drilling water or fuel oil."||"OBS: Caisson. ... The term is used to describe various components of offshore structures. For example, [it may refer] to the tank at the base of the stabilizing column on a semi-submersible drilling unit ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pony rod||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A sucker rod less than 25 ft. long.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||popcorn||"CORRECT||ADJ"||||||||||"DEF: Descriptive of any operation, rig, etc., that is close to being or is substandard, unsafe, or very inexpensive."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||portable mast||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A mast mounted on a truck and capable of being erected as a single unit.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||position-reference system||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Any system or method by which surveillance is maintained on the position of a floating offshore drilling rig in relation to the subsea wellhead.||"OBS: Ideally, the rig should always be directly over the wellhead ...to minimize wear on subsea equipment and facilitate the many operations involved with the equipment."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||positive choke||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A choke in which it is necessary to change the size of the orifice in order to change the rate of flow through the choke.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||possum belly||CORRECT||||||possum-belly tank||CORRECT||DEF: A receiving tank situated at the end of the mud-return line.||OBS: The flow of mud comes into the bottom of the device and travels over baffles to control mud flow over the shale shaker.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||possum belly||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A metal box under a truck bed that holds pipeline repair tools.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||posthole digger||"CORRECT||JARGON"||||||||||DEF: A small or makeshift drilling rig.||OBS: posthole digger: A slang term.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||power sub||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A hydraulically powered device used to turn the drill pipe, tubing, or casing in a well in lieu of a rotary."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||power tongs||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: A wrench that is used to make up or break out drill pipe, tubing, or casing to which the torque is provided by air or fluid pressure."||"CONT: Power tongs are pneumatically or hydraulically operated tools that serve to spin the pipe up tight and, in some instances, to apply the final makeup torque."||OBS: Conventional tongs are operated by a mechanical pull provided by a jerk line connected to a cathead.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||prime mover||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A steam engine, electric motor, or internal-combustion engine that is the source of power for the drilling rig in oil-well drilling."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||production packer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Any packer designed to make a seal between the tubing and casing for production purposes.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||production platform||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: An immobile, offshore structure constructed on pilings from which wells are ... produced ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||production rig||"CORRECT||GENERIC"||||||||||"DEF: A portable servicing or workover outfit, usually mounted on wheels and self-propelled."||"OBS: A well-servicing unit consists of a hoist and engine mounted on a wheeled chassis with a self-erecting mast. A workover rig is basically the same unit, plus a substructure with rotary, pump, pits, and other auxiliaries to permit handling and working a drill string."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||progressive cavity pump||CORRECT||||||progressive cavity pumping system||CORRECT||DEF: A form of sucker rod pumping unit in which the rotor is a chrome-plated steel external helix and the stator is a synthetic elastomer with a double internal helix permanently bonded into a steel housing. Rotation of the rods by a vertical spindle electric motor at the surface causes the rods to stretch a predetermined amount to maintain the rod string in tension. It also causes a cavity containing well fluid to progress upward. The system is a rotary positive-displacement unit.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||protection casing||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A string of casing set to protect a section of the hole and to permit drilling to continue to a greater depth ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pulling tool||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A hydraulically operated tool that is run in above the fishing tool and anchored to the casing by slips.||CONT: The pulling tool exerts a strong upward pull on the fish by means of hydraulic power derived from fluid that is pumped down the fishing string.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pulling unit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A well-servicing outfit used in pulling rods and tubing from the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pulsation dampener||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: Any gas- or liquid-charged, chambered device that serves to minimize periodic increases and decreases in pressure (as from a mud pump)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pump jack||CORRECT||||||pumpjack;crank balance pumping unit||"CORRECT||"||DEF: The motor-driven assemblage of gears and fabricated iron that sits astride an oil well.||DEF: A surface unit similar to a pumping unit but having no individual power plant.||OBS: Usually several pump jacks are operated by pull rods or cables from one central power source.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pumping tee||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A heavy-duty steel, T-shaped pipe fitting that is screwed or flanged to the top of a pumping well. The polished rod works through a stuffing box on top of the tee and in the run of the tee to operate a sucker-rod pump in the well. Pumped fluid is discharged through the side opening of the tee."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pumping unit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The machine that imparts the reciprocating motion to a string of sucker rods extending to the positive-displacement pump at the bottom of a well ...||"CONT: Pumping unit. Relatively few oil wells flow from natural pressures. Most require secondary means of removing the reservoir product. The most common of several methods is the pumping unit. A walking beam is operated like a seesaw, raising and lowering a plunger-type pump set near the bottom of the hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||pup joint||CORRECT||||||pup-joint||||"DEF: A length of drill pipe, tubing, or casing considerably shorter than 30 ft."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rabbit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A small plug that is run through a flow line to clean the line or to test for obstructions.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ram blowout preventer||CORRECT||||||ram blow-out preventer;ram preventer;ram-type preventer;ram-type BOP||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"||"DEF: A blowout preventer that uses rams to seal off pressure either on a hole with no pipe in it or on a hole with pipe in it, depending on its design ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ramp||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"DEF: Any incline or slope, particularly one connecting varying levels of an edifice ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||ram||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"DEF: A closure mechanism on a blow-out preventer stack; a hydraulically operated type of valve designed to close in a well as with a conventional valve or to close on tubing or drill pipe and maintain high pressure contact. Hydraulic pistons push the valves rams against the pipe, one ram on each side, making a pressure-tight contact."||"OBS: Rams are of three types: blind, pipe and shear."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||range length||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A grouping of pipe lengths.||CONT: API designation of range lengths are as follows: Casing: Range 1: 6-25 ft; Range 2: 25-34 ft; Range 3: 34 or more; Drill pipe: Range 1: 18-22 ft; Range 2: 27-30 ft; Range 3: 38-45 ft; Tubing: Range 1: 20-24 ft; Range 2: 28-32 ft.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rasp||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"DEF: A mill used in fishing operations prior to running the fishing tool, that reduces the size of the box or collar on the lost tool."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rathole connection||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The addition of a length of drill pipe or tubing to the active string. The length to be added is placed in the rathole, made up to the kelly, pulled out of the rathole, and made up into the string."||"OBS: Compare with  mousehole connection. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rathole||CORRECT||||||rat hole||CORRECT||"DEF: A hole in the rig floor 30-35 ft deep, lined with casing that projects above the floor, into which the kelly and swivel are placed when hoisting operations are in progress."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||reaming shell||CORRECT||||||reamer;reamer shell;drill reamer;rimer||"CORRECT;CORRECT||||"||"DEF: A tool employed in drilling and used for smoothing the wall of a well, enlarging the hole to the desired size, stabilizing the bit, straightening the wellbore where kinks or doglegs are encountered, and drilling directionally."||CONT: The outside surface of the reaming shell is provided with inset diamonds or other cutting media set to a diameter to cut a specific clearance for the core barrel.||"CONT: Reaming shells maintain the desired diameter of the [bore] hole. These make it unnecessary to ream with new bits to the bottom, reduce wear on the core barrel, and prevent sticking of bits due to loss of gauge."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||reaming||"CORRECT||ADJ"||||||reamer||"CORRECT||ADJ"||CONT: Reaming bit.||CONT: Reamer shell.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||recharge pump||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Any accumulator in a hydraulic blow out prevention control system installed on a well-head during the drilling of a well shall have sufficient useable fluid, with a safety factor of 1.5, to close the annular-type preventer, close, open and re-close one ram type preventer and open the hydraulically controlled remote valve in one continuous sequence, while retaining a pressure of 8400 kPa on the accumulator system with the recharge pump off during drilling and servicing operations."

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||reverse-circulation junk basket||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A special junk basket that is lowered into the hole to a position over the junk with normal circulation. A ball is then pumped down to cause the drilling fluid to exit through nozzles in the tool so that reverse circulation occurs and creates a vacuum inside the tool so that the junk is sucked into it.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rig irons||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: The metal parts (with the exception of nails, bolts, guy wires, and sand lines) used in the construction of the standard cable-tool rig."||OBS: rig irons: term rarely used in the singular (rig iron).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rig mat||CORRECT||||||matting;mat||"CORRECT||"||CONT: Equipment had been temporarily placed along the sides of the new lease and would be put in its operating position as soon as the matting was placed beside the proposed well head. The matting is a wood platform that is placed on the ground and the rig is set on top of the matting.||"CONT: Lister Rig Mats provide a solid base for all your drilling needs. Our Rig Mats are also utilized as: · loading pallets and ramps; · barge liners for heavy weight load distribution; · floors for field machine shops and warehouses; . pipeline and pedestrian bridges; · helicopter pads; · tank and camp foundations. The average life of a Rig Mat is 10 years, but many have continued to be active for 15-20 years. ... Our rig mats consist of two continuous wood sections with laminations glued and nailed together. The glue between the wooden planks reduces weight gain caused by liquid retention. Strength is mainly provided by the steel beams, and the wood sections assisted by lateral flat bars transfer part of the load from one beam to another."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rigid threaded conduit||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: All wiring must be in rigid threaded conduit, flexible armoured cable or appropriate flex cord."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||riser carrier||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Further development now concentrates on the semisubmersible and drill ship types as well as on the newly developed concept of a disconnectable riser carrier, a floating, dynamically positioned unit which can be disconnected from its mother unit."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||riser pipe||CORRECT||||||riser;marine riser;marine conductor;marine conductor pipe;stand pipe||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||||"||"DEF: The pipe and special fittings used on floating, offshore drilling rigs to establish a seal between the top of the wellbore, which is on the ocean floor, and the drilling equipment, located above the water."||CONT: A riser pipe serves as a guide for the drill stem from the drilling vessel to the wellhead and as a conductor of drilling fuel from the well to the vessel.||"CONT: The riser or marine conductor is ... run and latched on to the top of the wellhead, establishing the connection from the well to the rig."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||riser||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A flowline carrying oil or gas from the base of a production platform to the processing plant on the deck.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod back-off wheel||CORRECT||||||rod-backoff wheel||CORRECT||DEF: A device used to unscrew rods when the pump is stuck or sanded up and the well has to be stripped out.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod blowout preventer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A ram device used to close the annular space around the polished rod or sucker rod in a pumping well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod elevator||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to pull sucker rods. It has a bail attached to the rod hook to pull or run sucker rods.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod hanger||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to hang the sucker rods on the mast or in the derrick.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod hook||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A small, swivel hook having a fast-operating, automatic latch to close the hook opening when weight is suspended from the hook."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod rotor||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A ratchet mechanism actuated by a fixed rod or chain connection with the walking beam of a pumping unit that serves to provide a slow rate of rotation to the rod string, thereby distributing the wear uniformly on both rods and tubing."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rod stripper||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used when rods are coated with heavy oil or when the well may flow through the tubing while the rods are being pulled. It is a form of blowout preventer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||roll-dampening tank||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: [One of] the compartments on a floating, offshore drilling rig that are filled with water to offset the tendency of the rig to roll."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||roller bit||CORRECT||||||roller cone bit;roller-cone bit;roller rock bit;roller cutter bit;rolling cutter bit;rock bit||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A rotary boring bit consisting of two to four-cone-shaped, toothed rollers which are turned by the rotation of the drill rods. They are used in hard rock in oil well boring and other deep holes down to 15||000 feet and more. Although their penetration speed is somewhat slow, roller bits last longer which is a very important factor in deep drilling."||"CONT: In rolling cutter bits, the cone type bits currently manufactured have three cutters or two cutters. For general overall use the bit with three cones is a better balanced bit."||OBS: Roller-cone bits are also called rock bits. The surface of each cone is made up of rows of steel or tungsten carbide teeth or rows of tungsten carbide inserts. Tungsten carbide insert bits are usually used to drill extremely hard formations.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary drilling rig||CORRECT||||||rotary rig;rotary boring rig||"CORRECT||"||DEF: A modern drilling unit capable of drilling a well with a bit attached to a rotating column of steel pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary hose||CORRECT||||||mud hose;kelly hose;mud line||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: On a rotary drilling rig, the hose that conducts the drilling fluid from the mud pump and standpipe to the swivel and kelly ..."||"DEF: A reinforced, flexible rubber tube through which drilling mud flows from the stand pipe to the gooseneck ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary pump||"CORRECT||STANDARDIZED"||||||rotary positive-displacement pump||||"DEF: A pump that moves fluid by positive displacement, using a system of rotating vanes, gears, or lobes."||"OBS: A machine of the gear, vane, or screw type, as opposed to a rotodynamic pump."||OBS: rotary pump: term standardized by ISO.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary shoe||CORRECT||||||washover shoe||||"DEF: A length of pipe whose bottom edge is serrated and/or dressed with a hard, cutting material that is run into the wellbore around the outside of stuck casing, pipe, or tubing in order to mill away the obstruction causing the pipe to be stuck."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary table||CORRECT||RT||"CORRECT||SEE OBS"||||||"DEF: The principal component of a rotary, or rotary machine: used to turn the drill stem and support the drilling assembly."||CONT: The rotary table is situated in the center of the derrick floor immediately over the well bore and directly under the center of the derrick or mast. Its function is to support the weight of any pipe or casing run into the hole and to provide rotary motion to the drillpipe string via the kelly ...||OBS: RT: ... abbreviation ... used in drilling reports.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotary||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||rotary machine||CORRECT||DEF: The machine employed to impart rotational power to the drill stem while at the same time permitting vertical movement of the pipe for rotary drilling.||"CONT: Modern rotary machines employ a special component, the rotary bushing, to turn the kelly bushing, which permits vertical movement of the kelly while the stem is turning."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rotating head||CORRECT||||||rotating blowout preventer||CORRECT||"DEF: A sealing device used to close the annular space around the kelly when drilling with pressure at the surface, usually installed above the main blowout preventers."||CONT: A rotating head makes it possible to drill ahead even when there is pressure in the annulus that the weight of the drilling fluid is not overcoming. The head prevents the well from blowing out.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||rucker||"CORRECT||TRADEMARK"
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||safety clamp||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used to suspend a rod string after the pump has been spaced or when the weight of the rod string must be taken off the pumping equipment.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||safety joint||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: An accessory to the fishing tool, placed above it. If the tool cannot be disengaged from the fish, the safety joint permits easy disengagement of the string of pipe above the safety joint."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||safety latch||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A latch provided on a hook or swivel to prevent it from becoming detached prematurely.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||safety slide||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device normally mounted near the monkeyboard (or safety platform) that affords the derrickman a means of quick exit to the surface in case of emergency.||"CONT: The safety slide is usually affixed to a wire line, one end of which is attached to the derrick and the other end to the surface. To exit by the safety slide, the derrickman grasps a handle on the safety slide and rides it down to the ground."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||samson post||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A heavy, vertical timber that supports the well's walking beam."||"CONT: On a cable-tool rig, the samson post is located just ahead of the bandwheel. The walking beam rests on the samson post on a broad saddle bearing and moves up and down like a child's teeter totter."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sand line||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A wire rope used on well-servicing rigs to operate a swab or bailer. It is usually 9/6 in. in diameter and several thousand feet long.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sand pump||CORRECT||||||shell pump;sludger;sludge pump;American pump||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A cylinder with a valve at the bottom, lowered into a drill hole from time to time to take out the accumulated slime resulting from the action of the drill on the rock."||"DEF: A bailer fitted with a plunger for removing wet sand, mud, or silt from the bottom of a borehole."||"CONT: When [a bailer is] fitted with a plunger to which the bailing line is attached, it sucks the liquid in as it is lifted and is then called a sand pump or an American pump."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sanded-up||"CORRECT||ADJ"||||||||||DEF: Descriptive of equipment in which sand has accumulated so as to greatly impede its operation.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||saver sub||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device made up in the drill stem to absorb much of the wear between frequently broken joints (as between the kelly and drill pipe).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sawtooth bit||CORRECT||||||saw tooth bit;saw-toothed bit;calyx;toothed cutter head||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A tube-shaped or annular bit with the cutting edge serrated in the form of saw-like teeth.||OBS: The teeth may be hard-faced with stellite or boron tube material.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||scantlings||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||DEF: The dimensions of the structural members in the hull ...||"OBS: [These dimensions include] the size and thickness of materials, particularly those used in the fabrication of ships and offshore structures."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||scratcher||CORRECT||||||casing scraper||CORRECT||DEF: A device fastened to the outside of casing that serves to remove the mud cake from the wall of the hole to condition it for cementing.||"CONT: By rotating and moving the casing string up and down as it is being run into the hole, the scratchers take away the mud cake so that the cement can make a good bond to the formation."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||screen pipe||CORRECT||||||screened pipe;screen liner||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A perforated pipe having a straining or filtering device, usually closely wound coils of wire wrapped around the pipe, for the purpose of admitting well fluids while excluding sand."||CONT: A screen liner is perforated and then arranged with a wire wrapping which acts as a sieve to prevent the entry of sand particles.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||screw packer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A packer in which the packing element is expanded by rotating the pipe; used when it is not desirable to put tubing weight on the packer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||scuffle hoe||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A scraper similar to a hoe except that the blade is straight; used to clean the derrick floor or to scrape weeds and small growth off the lease yard.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||seating nipple||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A special tube installed in a string of tubing that has machined contours to receive a matching plug with locking pawls to regulate or shut off flow, anchor a pump, or permit installation of a flow regulator."||CONT: A sucker-rod pump may use a cup or mechanical hold-down for attachment to a seating nipple.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||secondary valve||CORRECT||||||backup valve||CORRECT||"CONT: Working spools must include ... outlets with full opening gate valves to serve as primary control ... a kill side with a primary valve and a check valve, while the bleed off line must have a primary and a secondary (backup) valve ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||semi-circular ram||||||||||||"CONT: In case of a blow-out during drilling, two safety devices are provided. First are the Shaffer gates ... which can be closed almost instantaneously either manually or by means of compressed air. The gates have semi-circular rubber rams that can fit closely around the drill stem, drill collar or casing, as may be appropriate, so as to seal-off the surrounding annular space."||"OBS: ram: The closing and sealing component on a blowout preventer. One of three types - blind, pipe, or shear - may be installed in several preventers mounted in a stack of top of the wellbore."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||semiexpendable gun||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A perforating gun that consists of a metallic strip on which encapsulated shaped charges are mounted. After the gun is fired, the strip is retrieved."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||settling pit||CORRECT||||||settling tank;middle tank||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The mud pit into which mud flows and in which heavy solids are given the opportunity to settle out. Often auxiliary equipment must be installed (as desanders) to speed this process.||"OBS: Also known as the settling tank or middle tank, being the centre of three elements of a mud pit. The others are the active tank and the reserve tank."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shaker pit||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The mud pit adjacent to the shale shaker, usually the first pit into which the mud flows after returning from the hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sharpener||||||||grinder
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shear ram||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A ram specially designed to cut through or shear drill pipe when the string is in the hole and it is necessary to seal the bore completely and quickly against high well pressure.||"DEF: A closure mechanism on a well's blowout preventer stack fitted with chisel-like jaws that are hydraulically operated. When the ram is closed on the pipe the jaws or blades cut the pipe, permitting the upper section to be removed from the BOP stack."||CONT: ... shear rams cut through drill pipe and then form a seal.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shear/blind ram||CORRECT||||||shear blind ram;shear-blind ram;shearing blind ram;blind shear ram||"CORRECT;CORRECT||||"||"CONT: A shear/blind ram may be used in place of a conventional blind ram and, when used, a ram blanking tool must be available to provide a back up to sealing capabilities of the blind ram."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shirttail||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The part of a drilling bit on which the cone is anchored.||"CONT: The shirttails extend below the threaded pin of the bit and are usually rounded on bottom, much as the tail of a man's shirt."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shoe joint||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A short section of casing, usually the bottom joint of the string, bounded by the casing shoe and the float collar which is used to contain the tail end cement slurry.    "

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||shothole plug||CORRECT||||||shot-hole plug||CORRECT||"DEF: A plug, usually of wood, used by seismic field parties to plug the hole upon completion of shooting."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||single well oil production system||||SWOPS||||||||"DEF: A converted tanker equipped with its own drilling derrick, gas processing plant and automatic positioning propellers."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||single-acting piston||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Most mud pumps have double-acting pistons, but some have single-acting pistons that function as plungers."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||single-shot instrument||CORRECT||||||singleshot instrument||CORRECT||DEF: A borehole surveying instrument that records only one measurement of the bearing and of the inclination of a hole on a single trip into the borehole.||CONT: A single-shot directional-survey instrument makes a single photograph of a compass reading of the drift direction and the number of degrees the hole is off vertical.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sinker bar||CORRECT||||||sinker||||DEF: A heavy weight or bar placed on or near a lightweight wire-line tool.||OBS: The bar provides weight so that the tool will lower properly into the well.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||slip hook||CORRECT||||||pelican hook||CORRECT||DEF: A device that is releasable under tension and that engages chain links and wire-rope fittings.

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||slurry blender||CORRECT||||||blender||CORRECT||"CONT: Sand, water and lubricating chemicals are mixed in a slurry blender, then injected into a well at pressures high enough to make cracks form in the surrounding rock, releasing the gas or oil trapped within its pores. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||slush pit||CORRECT||||||slushpit;mud pit;mud tank||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: The reservoir or tank, usually made of steel plates, through which the drilling mud is cycled to allow sand and fine sediments to settle out, where additives are mixed with mud, and where the fluid is temporarily stored before being pumped back into the well."||"CONT: Mud pits may be further classified as  shaker pits||  settling pits|| and  suction pits|| according to their main purposes."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||smart pig||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A sophisticated instrument package sent through pipelines to test for corrosion and buckling.   
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||solid wireline||CORRECT||||||solid wire line||CORRECT||"DEF: A special wireline made of brittle but very strong steel, usually 0.066 to 0.092 in. in diameter (as opposed to stranded wirelines, which may be 3/16 in. or larger)."||"CONT: Solid, or slick, wire lines are used for depth measurements and for running special devices into a well under pressure."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sonde||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A logging-tool assembly; usually the device on the logging assembly that senses and transmits formation data.||CONT: In well logging terms a sonde is the name given to a transducer or electrode of an electric log.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spacing clamp||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A clamp used to hold the rod string in pumping position when the well is in the final stages of being put back on the pump.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spade-end wedge||"CORRECT||SPECIFIC"||||||||||DEF: A type of deflecting wedge in boreholes.||"OBS: In French, the term  sifflet déviateur refers to any type of deflecting wedge."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spaghetti||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Tubing or drill pipe of a very small outside diameter (below ... 2 inches - 51 mm).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spider||CORRECT||||||poor-boy junk basket;poor boy||"CORRECT||"||"DEF: A circular, steel device that holds slips serving to support a suspended string of drill pipe, casing, or tubing."||"CONT: ... a poor-boy junk basket is a homemade or other inexpensive device for collecting small, nondrillable material in the wellbore."||OBS: A spider may be split or solid.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spinning cathead||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A spooling attachment on the makeup cathead to permit use of a spinning chain to spin up or make up drill pipe.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spinning chain||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A Y-shaped chain used to spin up (tighten) one joint of drill pipe into another. In use, one end of the chain is attached to the tongs, another end to the spinning cathead, and the third end is free. The free end is wrapped around the tool joint and the cathead pulls the chain off the joint, causing the joint to spin (turn) rapidly and tighten up. After the chain is pulled off the joint, the tongs are secured in the same spot, and continued pull on the chain (and thus on the tongs) by the cathead makes the joint up to final tightness."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spirally grooved drill collar||CORRECT||||||fluted drill collar||CORRECT||"DEF: A drill collar with a round cross section that has a long continuous groove or flute machined helically into its outer surface. The spiralled groove provides space between the wall of the hole and the body of the collar, minimizing the area of contact between the hole wall and collar; thus the possibility of differential pressure sticking is reduced."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||splice||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||||||"OBS: Unlike a knot, a splice does not significantly increase the diameter of the line at the point where the parts are joined."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||split-barrel sampler||CORRECT||||||split-tube sampler||CORRECT||DEF: A drive-type soil sampler with a split barrel.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spud bit||CORRECT||||||spudding bit||CORRECT||"DEF: A broad drilling tool, generally without teeth, used to drill through soft formations."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||spudder||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A portable cable-tool drilling rig, which may be mounted on a truck or trailer."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||square drill collar||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A special drill collar, generally square in shape but with rounded edges, used to control the straightness or direction of the hole; often a part of a packed-hole assembly."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||squinch joint||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A special threadless tool joint for large-diameter pipe, especially conductor pipe, sometimes used on offshore drilling rigs."||"OBS: When the box is brought down over the pin and weight is applied, a locking device is actuated to seat the joints. Because no rotation is required to make up these joints, their use can save time when running the conductor pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stabbing board||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A temporary platform erected in the derrick or mast at an elevation of 20 to 40 ft above the derrick floor.||"OBS: The derrickman or other crew member works on this board while casing is being run in a well. It may be simply a wooden board or a fabricated assembly of steel girders floored with antiskid material and powered electrically to raise or lower it to the desired level for stabbing pipe. A stabbing board serves the same purpose as a monkeyboard, or safety platform, but the former is only a temporary structure whereas the latter are permanent structures."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stabbing valve||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: A stabbing valve is kept on the work floor to put into tubing if needed, when the well begins blowing in. ... The stabbing valve must ... (a) be a National Association of Corrosion Engineers rated full opening valve with the proper threads to mate to the completion string thread in use; (b) the stabbing valve must have a pressure rating equal to or greater than the blow out preventer pressure rating; (c) extended bails must be used to allow string weight to be borne by the tubing, rather than the stabbing valve; (d) the stabbing valve must not be used as a working valve; (e) the stabbing valve must be stored in an area immediately accessible to the well bore."||CONT: Every drilling installation should be equipped with ancillary well control equipment consisting of ... at least two stabbing valves with appropriate cross-over subs to fit each type of connection in the drilling assembly which should be designed to be safely and quickly installed in the drilling assembly and closed to isolate and control pressure in the drill stem to allow the kelly or high pressure circulating head to be installed.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stand pipe||CORRECT||||||standpipe||CORRECT||DEF: The vertical pipe rising along the side of the derrick or mast that joins the mud pump to the rotary hose and through which mud is pumped.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||standard derrick||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A derrick that is built piece by piece at the drilling location as opposed to a jackknife mast, which is a portable, folding mast that is already assembled."||"OBS: Standard derricks have been replaced almost totally by jackknife masts; however, in some deep drilling locations and on some offshore drilling rigs, they are still employed."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||steam rig||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A rotary drilling rig in which steam engines operate as prime movers.||OBS: Steam rigs have been replaced almost totally by mechanical rigs or electric rigs.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||steam-jacketed mixing and kneading machine||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: Dr. D.S. Pasternack ... was hired to assist Clark with the problem of dehydrating the wet oil produced by the plant ... The answer they found was to mix the bitumen with salt in a steam-jacketed mixing and kneading machine, with the temperature precisely controlled. Using this method, they were able to reduce the total water and mineral content to less than two percent."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||steel fabrication||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: The Group has in-house capacity in a number of equipment components, including piping, and steel fabrications for offshore and onshore structures."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||steerable drill bit||CORRECT||||||steerable bit||CORRECT||DEF: A drill bit capable of changing direction while drilling. ||"CONT: Conventional horizontal drilling utilizes a specialized, steerable drill bit capable of drilling multiple holes up to 5||000 feet horizontally at depths down to 13||000 feet. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stinger||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: Any cylindrical or tubular projection, usually relatively small in diameter, that extends below a downhole tool and serves to guide the tool to a particular, desired spot (as in the center of a portion of a stuck pipe)."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||storm choke||CORRECT||||||tubing safety valve;bottom-hole choke;bottomhole choke;bottom-hole flow bean;downhole safety valve||"CORRECT;CORRECT||||||"||DEF: A device with a restricted opening that is placed in the lower end of the tubing through which the oil flows to the surface. Its purpose is to control the rate of flow.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||straddle packer||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: Two packers separated by a spacer of appropriate length.||CONT: A straddle packer may be used for isolating section of open hole to be treated or tested or for isolating certain areas of perforated casing from the rest of the perforated section.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||string||CORRECT||||||string of rods;drilling string;drill string;drill pipe string;string of drillpipe;pipe string;drill stem||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;SEE OBS||||||"||"DEF: An assembly, consisting of kelly, drill pipes, tools, collars and drilling bit joined together to form a string, which is suspended from a swivel in the derrick, and rotated by the rotary table. It is made up piece by piece, stands of pipe being added as the bit penetrates the formation."||"CONT: The bit is fastened to the string, a long stretch of steel pipe sections that have been screwed together. The string hangs inside a casing called the conductor pipe."||"OBS: Strictly, the drill string as described [in the source Whitehead, H., An A-Z Offshore Oil & Gas: an Illustrated International Glossary and Reference Guide to the Offshore Oil & Gas Industries and their Technology (WHIOF, 1983)] is the drill stem, and the drill string consists only of pipes and joints, but the term drill stem is seldom used other than with reference to a drill stem test."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stripper head||CORRECT||||||stripper||CORRECT||DEF: A blowout-prevention device consisting of a gland and packing arrangement bolted to the wellhead.||CONT: A stripper head is often used to seal the annular space between tubing and casing when working on a well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stripper rubber||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A rubber disk surrounding drill pipe or tubing that removes mud as the pipe is brought out of hole.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stripper rubber||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The pressure-sealing element of a stripper blowout preventer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||structural mast||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A portable mast constructed of angular as opposed to tubular steel members.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stud tube||||||||studded tube
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||stud-link chain||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An anchor chain each link of which has a bar (stud) across the short dimension of the link to prevent kinking and deformation under load.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||studded side outlet casing bowl||CORRECT||||||||||CONT: Every operator shall ensure that the minimum blow out prevention system ... in respect of a well that is drilled to a depth not exceeding 1800 metres be mounted on a flanged or studded side outlet casing bowl with a minimum working pressure rating of 21.0 MPa ...
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||submerged well head||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||submersible pump||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A pump that is placed below the level of fluid in a well.||OBS: This pump is usually driven by an electric motor and consists of a series of rotating blades that impart a centrifugal motion to the fluid to lift it to the surface.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsea completion system||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A submersible apparatus similar to a bathysphere in which men are lowered to the ocean bottom to work on the wellheads of completed wells. The wellhead contains a cellar to which the system is attached, allowing the men to work in a dry atmosphere."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsea manifold||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: For smaller fields, rather than being drilled from a large central platform, the wells are drilled from subsea clusters. For these types of wells, the wellhead and Christmas tree is installed directly on the seabed, with production from several wells co-mingled at a subsea manifold. Subsea manifolds are often linked by pipelines and umbilical control lines back to a nearby platform, where engineers can control and monitor the oil and gas production."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsea test tree||CORRECT||SSTT||CORRECT||||||DEF: A device designed to be landed in a subsea wellhead or blowout-preventer stack to provide a means of closing in the well on the ocean floor so that a drill-stem test of an offshore well can be obtained.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsea tie-back||CORRECT
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsea well-head structure||CORRECT||||||subsea wellhead structure||CORRECT||"CONT: The White Rose partners intend to develop the field using a floating production, storage and offloading system (FPSO) and subsea well-head structures located in  glory holes ."||CONT: The '707 and '119 patents are directed to a subsea wellhead structure.||OBS: wellhead: The equipment installed at the top of the wellbore used to support the casing strings installed in the well and the rate of flow of fluids from the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||substructure||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The foundations on which the derrick and engines sit, containing space for storage and well control equipment."||"CONT: In drilling work, the standard derrick has four legs standing at the corners of the substructure ... The substructure is an assembly of heavy beams used to elevate the derrick above the ground and provide space to install blowout preventers, casing heads, etc."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||subsurface safety valve||CORRECT||SSSV||CORRECT||tubing safety valve||||DEF: A safety device installed in the upper wellbore to provide emergency closure of the producing conduits in the event of an emergency.||"OBS: Two types of subsurface safety valve are available: surface-controlled and subsurface controlled. In each case, the safety-valve system is designed to be fail-safe, so that the wellbore is damage to the surface production-control facilities."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sucker rod||CORRECT||||||pumping rod||||"DEF: A special steel rod, a number of which are screwed together to make up the mechanical link from the beam pumping unit on the surface to the sucker-rod pump at the bottom of a well."||OBS: Sucker rods are threaded on each end and manufactured to exact dimensional standards and metal specifications set by API.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sucker-rod coupling||CORRECT||||||sucker-rod joint||||DEF: An internally threaded fitting used to join sucker rods.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||sucker-rod pump||CORRECT||||||rod pump||CORRECT||DEF: The downhole assembly used to lift fluid to the surface by the reciprocating action of the sucker-rod string.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||suction line||CORRECT||||||loading line||CORRECT||DEF: The line that carries a product out of a tank to the suction side of the pumps.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||surface drilling unit||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: An offshore drilling rig that is either a drill ship or a drilling barge ...||OBS: So called because the rig floats on the surface of the water.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||surface safety valve||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A valve mounted in the Christmas tree assembly that stops the flow of fluids from the well if damage occurs to the assembly.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||surface string||CORRECT||||||surface casing;surface pipe||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The first string of casing to be set in a well.||"DEF: A short string of casing installed inside the conductor pipe in a well, and forming the base for attachment of well-head equipment. It is cemented in place just like any other casing, and derives its name from the fact that the top protrudes above the surface of the borehole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||swivel hook||CORRECT||||||rotating hook;mooring shackle||"CORRECT||"||"CONT: A block with one or multiple pulleys or sheaves may have a loose hook, swivel (rotating) hook, or shackles."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||swivelship||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A drill ship being invented for use in the Arctic that automatically turns into moving ice, much as a weathervane points into the wind, and allows the ice to pass harmlessly alongside while the ship remains attached to the pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tail chain||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A short length of chain that is attached to the end of a winch line, usually provided with a special hook that fastens to objects."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tail pipe||CORRECT||||||tailpipe||||DEF: A pipe run in a well below a packer.||DEF: ... a pipe extending below a packer and resting on the bottom to resist the weight being applied to set the packer.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||take down||"CORRECT||VERB PHRASE"||||||take out||"CORRECT||VERB PHRASE"||DEF: To remove a joint or stand of pipe from the drill stem.||CONT: Couplings and unions should be used generously in pipelines to permit taking down portions of the pipe without dismantling large portions of the piping installation.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||taper tap||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A fishing tool that is run into a hollow fish (as drill collars) and rotated to cut sufficient threads to provide a firm grip, thus permitting the fish to be pulled and recovered."||OBS: The taper tap is the male counterpart of a die collar.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tapered string||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: Drill pipe, tubing, sucker rods, and so forth with a diameter larger near the top of the well than that below."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||taut-line position-reference system||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A system for monitoring the position of a floating, offshore drilling rig in relation to the subsea wellhead in which a taut, steel line is stretched from the rig to the ocean floor."||"OBS: An inclinometer measures the slope of the line at the rig, and, because the line is assumed to be straight from the rig to the ocean floor, any slope in the line indicates that the rig has moved."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||telescoping derrick||CORRECT||||||telescopic derrick||CORRECT||"DEF: A portable mast that is capable of being erected as a unit, usually by means of a tackle that hoists the wire line but sometimes hydraulic pistons. Generally the upper section of a telescoping derrick is nested (telescoped) inside the lower section of the structure and raised to full height by the wire line or by hydraulic means after it is in vertical position."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||telescoping joint||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A device employed in the marine riser system of a mobile, offshore drilling rig to compensate for the vertical motion of the rig caused by wind, waves, etc. It consists of an inner barrel that is attached beneath the rig floor and an outer barrel attached to the riser pipe. It is an integral part of the riser system."||"CONT: Inside diameter of the riser pipe and its size compatibility with the subsea blowout preventers and the proposed well program are important to the potential customer. The telescoping joint, its diameter and length of stroke, and the type of flexible joint, its diameter and maximum angle, need consideration."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||temper screw||CORRECT||||||temple screw||CORRECT||DEF: A part on a cable-tool rig used to regulate the force of the blow delivered to the drill bit.||OBS: [The temper screw] is attached to the walking beam and controls the feed rate of the drilling tools.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||template||CORRECT||||||drilling template;base plate||"CORRECT||"||"CONT: A method is described for drilling widely spaced boreholes into a hydrocarbon producing subsea formation comprising the steps of positioning a subsea drilling template on the bottom of a body of water, the subsea drilling template including laterally disposed, substantially cylindrical drilling guides ..."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||temporary guide base||CORRECT||TGB||CORRECT||||||"DEF: The initial piece of equipment lowered to the ocean floor once a mobile, offshore drilling rig has been positioned on location. It serves as an anchor for the guidelines and as a foundation for the permanent guide base. It has an opening in the center through which the bit passes."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tensioner system||CORRECT||||||tensioning system;tensioner||||DEF: A device installed on a floating offshore drilling rig to maintain a constant tension on the riser pipe despite any vertical motion the rig makes.||"CONT: ... the guidelines must be tensioned, and a separate tensioner system is provided for them as well."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||terpeneless||ADJ
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||thick-walled||"CORRECT||ADJ. PHRASE"||||||thick walled||ADJ. PHRASE||"CONT: Thick-walled, corroded sections of pipe."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||thribble board||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: The monkeyboard, or working platform of the derrickman, when it is located at a height in the derrick equal to three lengths of pipe joined together."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||thribble||"CORRECT||NOUN"||||||triple||"CORRECT||NOUN"||DEF: A stand of pipe made up of three joints and handled as a unit.||"OBS: Pipe is often stacked in thribbles (about 30 metres overall) inside a derrick, but doubles and fourbles are sometimes assembled, depending on the height of the derrick."||"OBS: See also  single||  double|| and  fourble. "
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tongs||"CORRECT||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: The large wrenches used for turning when making up or breaking out drill pipe, casing, tubing, or other pipe ..."||"OBS: ... variously called casing tongs, rotary tongs, and so forth according to the specific use. Power tongs are pneumatically or hydraulically operated tools that serve to spin the pipe up tight, and, in some instances, to apply the final makeup torque."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tool joint||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: The point at which drill-stem equipment is provided with screw threads by means of which various members can be coupled.||"CONT: Tool joints have coarse, tapered threads and seating shoulders designed to sustain the weight of the drill stem, to withstand the strain of frequent coupling and uncoupling, and to provide a leakproof seal. The male section of the joint, the pin, is attached to one end of a length of drill pipe, and the female section, the box, is attached to the other end."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tool-joint box||CORRECT||||||||||"OBS: Tool joint. ... The male section of the joint, the pin, is attached to one end of a length of drill pipe, and the female section, the box, is attached to the other end."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tool-joint pin||CORRECT||||||||||"OBS: Tool joint. ... The male section of the joint, the pin, is attached to one end of a length of drill pipe, and the female section, the box, is attached to the other end."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||top-drive auger rig||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A hydraulically operated rig mounted on the back of a truck.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||traveling block||CORRECT||||||travelling block||CORRECT||"DEF: An arrangement of pulleys, or sheaves, through which drilling cable is reeved and that moves up and down in the derrick or mast."||"CONT: The drilling cable is reeved over the sheaves of the crown block alternately with the sheaves of the traveling block, which is hoisted and lowered in the derrick by means of the drilling cable."||"CONT: The kelly is suspended by a hook-and-swivel assembly to a traveling block, which is connected by a steel cable to a crown block at the top of the drilling rig."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||treatment facilities||"CORRECT||PLUR"||||||||||CONT: ... to divert contaminated oil to treatment facilities.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tricone bit||CORRECT||||||tricone roller bit;tricone rock bit;three-cone bit;tri-cone bit;tri-cone roller bit||"CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"||DEF: A type of bit in which each of three toothed and conical cutters is mounted on friction-reducing bearings and is forced into the formation by the weight and rotary motion of the drill stem.||"CONT: Penetration is normally effected by the chipping, spalling and abrasive action of special serrated tri-cone  bits of very tough steel, the depth of the serrations being dependent upon the hardness of the rocks encountered."||PHR: Serrated tricone bit.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing elevator||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A clamping apparatus used to pull tubing.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing hanger||CORRECT||||||boll-weevil hanger||||DEF: An arrangement of slips built into a steel housing and engaged in the upper end of the wellhead that serves as a support for the suspended tubing string.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing head||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A flanged fitting that supports the tubing string, seals off pressures between the casing and the outside of the tubing, and provides a connection that supports the Christmas tree."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing safety valve||CORRECT||||||storm choke;Storm Choke||"CORRECT;CORRECT||TRADEMARK"||DEF: A device installed in the tubing string of a producing well to shut in the flow of production if the flow exceeds a preset rate.||OBS: These valves are widely used in offshore wells to prevent pollution and further damage should the wellhead fail for any reason.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing spider||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A device used with slips to prevent tubing from falling into the hole when a joint of pipe is being unscrewed and racked.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing tongs||"CORRECT||SEE OBS||PLUR"||||||||||"DEF: The large wrenches used to break out and make up tubing. They may be operated by hand, hydraulic power, or pneumatic (air) power."||OBS: tubing tongs: term rarely used in the singular (tubing tong).
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tubing||CORRECT||||||production tubing;tubing of extraction;tubing string;string of tubing;flowstring;flow string;production string;capital string;pay string;long string||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A small-diameter (2-4 in), removable pipe, set and sealed in a well inside a large-diameter casing placed in a producing horizon, through which oil and gas are produced (brought to the surface from the reservoir)."||"CONT: When oil is found, the drilling stops. The bit and string are pulled out of the hole, and a pipe called a production casing is put into the hole and cemented in place. Another pipe, called tubing, is put inside the casing. The oil will be pumped through the tubing, which is connected to valves on a Christmas tree."||OBS: Production tubing is steel pipe smaller in diameter than the production casing. It is lowered into the casing and held in place by packers which also isolate the producing layers of rocks.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tungsten carbide bit||CORRECT||||||tungsten carbide insert bit;tungsten carbide drill bit||"CORRECT||"||DEF: A type of roller-cone bit or rock bit; ...||CONT: Tungsten carbide insert bits are usually used to drill extremely hard formations.||"OBS: For very hard rock drilling, bits with chisel-shaped tungsten carbide inserts have been used. These crush the formation as the bit rotates."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tungsten carbide insert||CORRECT||||||tungsten-carbide insert||CORRECT||"DEF: In mining, a slug composed of tungsten-carbide alloy shaped and mounted in the bit face so that the slug acts as the cutting edge of the bit."||"CONT: For very hard rock drilling, bits with chisel-shaped tungsten carbide inserts have been used. These crush the formation as the bit rotates."||CONT: Roller-cone bit. ... The surface of each cone is made up of rows of steel or tungsten carbide teeth or rows of tungsten carbide inserts.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tungsten carbide tooth||CORRECT||||||||||CONT: Roller-cone bit. ... The surface of each cone is made up of rows of steel or tungsten carbide teeth or rows of tungsten carbide inserts.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||tungsten carbide||CORRECT||WC||"CORRECT||SEE OBS"||wolfram carbide||||"DEF: A hard, gray powder; insoluble in water; readily attacked by nitric-hydrofluoric acid mixture; melts at 2780°C; used in tools, dies, ceramics, cermets, and wear-resistant mechanical parts, and as an abrasive."||"CONT: ... an extremely hard material, usually crushed tungsten carbide, ...is applied to the outside surfaces of tool joints, drill collars, stabilizers, and other rotary drilling tools in order to minimize wear to these surfaces when they are in contact with the wall of the hole."||"OBS:  WC is a chemical symbol."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||turbodrill||CORRECT||||||turbo drill;turbo-drill||CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: A drill developed in the U.S.S.R. for drilling deep oil wells. One type is designed as a turbine and driven by the drilling fluid which is circulated at high pressure.||"CONT: There are two types of turbodrill or down-hole mud motor: the turbine, of which there are about six successful types, and the Dynadrill, a Moyno pump operating in reverse, consisting of a spiral shaft contained within a rubber sleeve. ... The down-hole turbine is basically similar to a gas turbine having a multi-stage stator and rotor."||"CONT: When a turbodrill is used, rotary motion is imparted only at the bit; therefore, it is not necessary to rotate the drill stem. Although straight holes can be drilled with the tool, it is used often in directional drilling."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||turtleback||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A coupling on a rod line shaped like a turtle's back.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||twist drill||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A fishing tool used on a string of tubing to drill a hole in a tool that has been so battered that it fills the hole.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||two-phase transmission pipe||CORRECT||||||||||"CONT: ... although water hammer as such does not occur, unexplained pipe vibrations have sometimes been observed on two-phase transmission pipes."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||undergauge bit||CORRECT||||||undergage bit||CORRECT||DEF: A drilling bit whose outside diameter has been worn down until it is smaller than the bit specifications call for.||CONT: A 6 7/8-in. bit worn down to 6 5/8 in. is an undergauge bit.||"OBS: Often, bit gauges are used to determine if the bit has been worn to a diameter smaller than specifications. Such a bit is undergauge."

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||wall hook||CORRECT||||||wall hook guide;overshot guide||CORRECT;CORRECT||"DEF: A device that is used in fishing for drill pipe. If the upper end of the lost pipe is leaning against the side of the wellbore, the wall hook centers it in the hole so that it may be recovered with an overshot, which is run on the fishing string and attached to the wall hook."

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||washover pipe||CORRECT||||||wash pipe||"CORRECT||LESS FREQ"||"DEF: An accessory used in fishing operations to go over the outside of tubing or drill pipe that is stuck in the hole because of cuttings, mud, etc., that have collected in the annulus. The washover pipe cleans the annular space and permits recovery of the pipe."

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||watertight door||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A door on ships or mobile offshore drilling rigs so constructed that, when closed, it will not allow the passage of water and can withstand the pressure of the water."||CONT: Watertight doors. Such doors below the waterline are either vertical or horizontal sliding type. The doors can be operated by power and actuated by remote control.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||wear sleeve||CORRECT||||||||||"DEF: A hollow, cylindrical device attached to a joint of drill pipe midway between the tool joints that minimizes wear to the outside of the pipe at points where the pipe touches the wall of the hole."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||weight indicator||CORRECT||||||drillometer||||"DEF: An instrument near the driller's position or a drilling or workover rig that shows the weight suspended from the hook when the bit is off the bottom. From this reading, weight on the bit can be inferred during drilling operations."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||weight on the bit||CORRECT||||||weight on bit;bit weight;bit load;load on the bit;bit loading||CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT;CORRECT||DEF: The difference between the net weight of the entire drill stem and the resulting reduced weight when the bit is resting on bottom.||"CONT: The load on the bit refers to the amount of weight of the drill collars allowed to rest on the bit - that is, the weight on the bit."||"OBS: bit weight: Source: Kennedy, John L. Fundamentals of Drilling: Technology and Economics. Tulsa (Oklahoma): PennWell, 1983, p. 145."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||well casing||"CORRECT||OFFICIALLY APPROVED"||||||casing||"CORRECT||STANDARDIZED"||"DEF: A special steel tubing welded or screwed together and lowered into a borehole to prevent [the] entry of loose rock, gas, or liquid into the borehole or to prevent loss of circulation liquid into porous, cavernous, or crevassed ground."||"CONT: There may be several strings of casing in a well, one inside the other. The first casing put in a well is called surface pipe which is cemented into place and serves to shut out shallow water formations and also as a foundation or anchor for all subsequent drilling activity."||CONT: Drilling is started by attaching a short drill collar and a large bit to the kelly and drilling a hole to about 50 ft. A length of large size casing is run into this and cemented to the formation. This is called the conductor.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||well control assembly||CORRECT||||||||||"OBS:  Well control means the control of the movement of fluids in or from a well."
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||well-head structure||CORRECT||||||wellhead structure||CORRECT||"CONT: The wells and wellhead structures are to be located in 1400 meters of water, with the associated FPSO being located at the foot of the canyon slope in 750 meters of water."||OBS: wellhead: The equipment installed at the top of the wellbore used to support the casing strings installed in the well and the rate of flow of fluids from the well.
Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||wellhead cellar||CORRECT||||||||||DEF: A vessel that encloses the top of a producing oil well on the ocean floor and allows well service to be done in one-atmosphere conditions with conventional surface tools.

Today ... it is called the  Gypsy head. "

Equipment (Oil and Natural Gas Extraction)||wiper plug||CORRECT||||||cementing plug||CORRECT||"DEF: A rubber-bodied, plastic- or aluminum-cored device that is used to separate cement and drilling fluid as they are being pumped down the inside of the casing during cementing operations."||"CONT: A cementing plug is ... inserted, followed by drilling fluid, which forces the cement to the bottom of the hole and up into the space between casing and wall ... until it reaches the surface along with any remaining mud."||OBS: Wiper plugs also remove drilling mud that adheres to the inside of the casing.

In the market octanes case, all 23 refineries required addition of isomerization facilities. [Definition standardized by ISO.]||OBS: This term refers in particular to the conversion of straight chain hydrocarbons to branched chain hydrocarbons.||OBS: isomerization: term standardized by ISO.
